Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The Final Tier
questDatabase.description: So now we are in quite undiscovered country. With your help, we've expanded the variety of machines and tools we use to produce and keep inventory sorted and stocked. With the new components, we've opened up new possibilities, though. This is a new area of research for us, so let us see what interesting things we can create.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Warp Book
questDatabase.description:
So, some of the eggheads around here have been poking at the data on those strange §lEndermen§r. They've harnessed their strange §lteleporting§r powers into a simple §lbook§r for our use. This should be quite useful for us as §lAdventurers§r, letting us zip §lhome§r and back to freshly explored areas. 
    You will need an §5§lUnbound Warp Page§r to start with. When you hold one and §l§nRight Click§r, it will §lbind§r to the spot you are standing, as well as let you §lname§r it. You can then §l§nRight Click§r while holding the §lBound Warp Page§r to §lconsume§r it and §lteleport§r to the spot. §l§nSneak + Right Click§r to unbind a §lWarp Page§r.
    The §4§lWarp Book§r enables you to reuse these §lBound Warp Pages§r. Hold the §lbook§r and §l§nSneak + Right Click§r to be able to add §lpages§r to it. Then when you use the §5§lWarp Book§r, it will be give you a list of §lWarp Pages§r you added to it, enabling you to §lteleport§r to any of them as many times as you like.
    The §5§lDeathly Warp Page§r is special §lWarp Page§r. You can't bind it yourself, but when you §ldie§r, it will automatically §lbind§r itself to your §ldeath location§r, and stay in your §linventory§r when you §lrespawn§r.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Large Order - Armor Stands
questDatabase.description:
Armor Stands are in high demand, and not just to display Armor. Many times they are covered with foam and used as display dummies for shop windows.
    Only a fraction of these armor stands are used for their primary function, though. Some roboticists here have instead been wiring them up and getting them to move! How weird!

questDatabase.name: A Fashionable Greeting
questDatabase.description:
Hm hm hmmm, §3§lBitsy§r passed on to me that an §lassistant§r is §lstuck§r in another §lworld§r, possibly §lalone§r and... well, they could use all the §lhelp§r they can get! I take it that is §lyou§r? Of course it is, it has your §lname§r right here on my§3§l QUEST Tablet§r :§d§lBandit, Very Lost Assistant§r. 
    Don't worry, it's not saying you don't know §lanything§r, just the name we give §lAssistants§r who are kind of... §lunretrievable§r. You aren't exactly the FIRST §lassistant§r §3§lThe Ferret Business§r has §lteleported§r out of §lreach§r. But fret not my fine §lferret§r, with my help you'll be putting your own §lmark§r on that §lworld§r yet! In fact, why don't you make a §5§lsign§r so you can §lproclaim§r it §lyours§r?
    By §l§n§oSneaking§r§o when you place a §5§l§osign§r§o, you can lay it §l§oflat§r§o on the front of a §l§ochest§r§o, §l§oflat§r§o on the §l§oground§r§o, or even §l§oflat§r§o on the §l§oceiling§r§o!§r

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Bibliocraft
questDatabase.description:
A house is not a §lhome§r unless it has that... personal... §ltouch§r, I say. Whether its a §lshelf§r full of treasured §lknicknacks§r, a favorite §lpicture§r on the §lwall§r, or just simply a §ldesk§r to call your own and a §lbookshelf§r full of §lnovels§r. To make your house a §lhome§r, I know of a lot of different bits of §lfurniture§r and §ldecorations§r that look §lspectacular§r. Not only that, most everthing in §4§lBibliocraft§r is §lfunctional§r in some way as well! 
    Now to start, lets make this cute little §5§lDesk Bell§r. Its useful if you plan on running a §lhotel desk§r or a §lshop counter§r, otherwise its just a cute §ladornment§r.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Grand Timepiece
questDatabase.description:
A §ldigital clock§r is all well and good, easy to §lread§r at a glance, but it doesn't have much... well, §lstyle§r, does it? Sure sure, §lfancy fonts§r and §ldecorative frames§r are possible, but sometimes tried and true §lclassics§r give the best §lstyle§r to a situation! 
    The §5§lGrandfather Clock§r is §lelegant§r and really stands out in a §lroom§r. The §lclock face§r shows you the §llocal time§r, while the §lpendulum§r (the little swinging thing) is §lsynced§r to us here in §3§lThe Ferret Business§r, §lticking§r every §lReal second§r. You can make it §ltwice as tall§r by §lstacking§r one on §ltop§r of another, then §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r each §5§lClock§r with a §lScrewgun§r or §lHand Drill§r.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: No Writer's Block
questDatabase.description:
Given that you are kind of stuck in that§l world§r for a while, I bet you have a ton of things to §lwrite§r, right? §lNotes§r maybe, §linstructions§r to §lyourself§r or other §lassistants§r you may have §lfound§r. Or heck, §lbooks§r, entire §lnovels§r just §lswimming§r in your §lhead§r, and now the time to §lwrite§r them... well, when you aren't §lclawing§r and §lscraping§r about to §lsurvive§r. I have a lot of §lbeautiful§r and useful §lfurniture§r you can make use of!
    Even in this age of §lComputers§r, there is something §llovely§r about an old §5§lTypewriter§r. You can place a pile of §lpapers§r into it, and then §ltap§r away at the front to type up a§l novel§r! Or, you can hire a §lghostwriter§r! Give some §lcreature§r or §lanimal§r a §lname§r with a §lNametag§r, then plop them in §lfront§r of the §5§lTypewriter§r! Just note that... what they §lwrite§r maaay not be all that §llegible§r...
    By §lcombining§r the functions of a §lBookcase§r and a §lCrafting Table§r, the §5§lFancy Workbench§r can not only save §lspace§r, but also work better! With a normal §lBook§r, you can write a§l recipe§r to it on this, then§l place§r it onto the built in §lShelf§r (or any §lbook§r for that matter!)
    The §5§lTypesetting Table§r allows you to copy §lSigned Books§r onto §lPrinting Plates§r, to make a §lcopy§r of later. Hold the §lbook§r and §l§nRight Click§r it onto the §llower left§r spot on top of the §ltable§r. You can then §l§nSneak + Right Click§r it to turn it §lblue§r and §lsave§r it. §lHold§r and §l§nRight Click§r a §5§lPrinting Press Chase§r into the spot near the§l back§r of the §ltabletop§r, then §l§nRight Click§r the §lgray§r areas to the §lleft§r or §lright§r of the §5§lChase§r. You can select a saved §lbook§r here, and then apply a §lRedstone Signal§r to the §5§lTypesetting Table§r to §lcopy§r the book to the §5§lChase§r.
    You can then take the §5§lChase§r to the §5§lPrinting Press§r. §l§nRight Click§r it onto the §lcenter area§r to put it in, then §l§nRight Click§r some §lInk Sacs§r near it to apply §lInk§r to the §5§lPress§r. Take a regular §lBook§r (not a §lBook and Quill§r or a written §lBook§r), and §l§nRight Click§r it onto the §llower left countertop§r to §lplace§r it there. When all three §litems§r are in the §5§lPrinting Press§r, it will start working to make a §lcopy§r of the §lbook§r. When the §lbook§r turns §lBlue§r, you can pick it up!

questDatabase.name: Elegant Display
questDatabase.description:
Nothing makes better §ldecor§r than §lshowing off§r your §lcurios§r. Simple things like a pretty §lstone§r, to §lcomplicated§r things like a §lNether Star§r, can be§l shown off§r equally well in the right §lcircumstances§r. I have a wide array of§l shelves§r and ways to §lshow§r off your §lcollections§r.
    These §5§lBookcases§r are much more elegant than your §4§lVanilla§r §lBookshelf§r. You can §lstore§r up to 16 different §lbooks§r on this by §l§nRight Clicking§r a §lbook§r onto it to §lplace§r it in that spot, and later §lgrab§r it off by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r the§l book§r with an §lempty hand§r. For §lEnchanting§r purposes, every 8 §lbooks§r on a §5§lBookcase§r counts as a single §lBookshelf§r.
    Each §5§lShelf§r can§l hold§r up to 4 §lstacks§r of items. Place them on the §5§lShelf§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r one of the §lfour spots§r, and you can §lremove§r the item again by just §l§nRight Clicking§r it.
    You can §l§nRight Click§r almost any §ltool§r to §lplace§r it up on a§5§l Rack§r. §l§nRight Click§r it again to §lremove§r it.
    If you are a wiz §lAlchemist§r, you probably have a big pile of §lPotions§r about. A §5§lPotion Shelf§r are great for §lstoring§r and §ldisplaying§r them. Each one can hold 12 §lPotions§r for you! Simply §lplace§r them or §lremove§r them with a §l§nRight Click§r.
    If you have a §lunique§r, single §lspecial§r item you'd like to §ldisplay§r, why not make a §5§lCase§r just for it? These fancy §5§lCases§r can be opened by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r them with an §lempty hand§r, then the item §lplaced§r inside. §l§nSneak + Right Click§r again to §lclose§r the case and §lsecure§r the §ldisplay§r.
    Sometimes §lold school§r goodness can really improve a §lroom§r. If you have old §lJukebox Music Discs§r, you can §lplace§r them in this §5§lDisc Rack§r to display them nicely. You can §lplace§r these on the §lfloor§r, the §lwall§r, or even the §lceiling§r, and §lrotate§r them around by holding a §lScrewgun§r or §lHand Drill§r and §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r.
    §lDinnerware§r is a fancy, §ltimeless§r thing to add to any §ldining room§r. These §5§lPlates§r are large enough to hold three different §lfood §ritems, and can be §leaten§r off of §ldirectly§r.
    A §5§lCookie Jar§r should be a staple in all §lkitchens§r. It's a special one, in that any §litem§r put into it will show up as a §lCookie§r on the §loutside§r, making it a§l fantastic§r place to §lhide§r something. It even emits a §lRedstone Signal§r when the jar is §lopened§r, to make a §ltrap§r to catch §lCookie thieves§r!

questDatabase.name: Painted Dreams
questDatabase.description:
Wooden walls, stone §lwalls§r, §lwallpaper§r, all of it is nice but tends to be kind of §lmonotonous§r in large rooms, no? I like to §lbreak§r up large, §lempty§r expanses of §lwalls§r with §5§lPaintings§r! They come in lots of §lsizes§r, with a wide range of §ldesigns§r you can choose from! 
    You'll need a proper §5§lPainting Canvas§r to start with, something to §lprint§r the §ldesign§r onto. Take your §5§lPainting Canvas§r and place it into the §5§lPainting Press§r. You can §lchoose§r from a nice selection of §5§lPaintings§r to §lprint§r onto it. You can't §lplace§r this directly on the §lwall§r yet, you'll need to make a §5§lFrame§r for it.
    There are a bunch of different ways to §5§lFrame§r your §5§lPaintings§r on the wall. You can make a  §5§lBorderless§r one so it looks like a §lposter§r, or you can make varying style of §5§lFrames§r to place the §5§lPainting§r into. I'll only ask you to make §ltwo§r of them, though, don't worry!
    Know what else looks §lfantastic§r on a §lwall§r? A §lmap§r, of course! You can use these §5§lMap Frames§r much like the §5§lPainting Frames§r, but they have the added§l bonus§r of being useable with a few fantastic §ltools§r. When you have a §lmap§r up on a §5§lMap Frame§r, you can use the §5§lDrafting Compass§r to §lmark locations §ron it. With the §5§lWaypoint Compass§r, you can use it on a §lwaypoint§r you §lmarked§r with the §5§lDrafting Compass§r, or §l§nSneak + Right Click§r it to enter §lcoordinates§r and the §5§lCompass§r will §lpoint§r towards it.

Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Warrior's Pride
questDatabase.description:
To a §lfighter§r, a lot of his §larms§r and §larmor§r are more about helping him §lsurvive§r than they are about looks... but thats perfect, as they tend to §lLOOK good§r as well. Symmetrical §larmor§r, a lot of §llayers§r, §ltextures§r, all of it combined look §lfantastic§r. You can proudly show off your §lgear§r with these §lstands§r.
    You can §ldisplay§r various §loutfits§r on this §5§lArmor Stand§r. §l§nRight Clicking§r will open up an §linterface§r where you can §lplace§r the §larmor§r, but if you §l§nSneak + Right Click§r instead, you'll §lswap§r whatever you are §lwearing§r (even if its nothing!) with the §larmor§r piece you §lclick§r!
    You can place almost any §lsword §rinto this §5§lSword Pedastal§r to §ldisplay§r it. When it is holding a §lsword§r, it emits a §lRedstone Signal§r, which is great for creating showy §llight effects§r on cue.

questDatabase.name: Informational Fancy
questDatabase.description:
Not my usual way to §lspruce§r up a §lplace§r, but using §lSigns§r and §lLabels§r can be quite helpful, and who says these things can't also §lLOOK§r nice as well? Made with the various types of §lwood§r, you can get these to fit into any §ldecorative§r theme, I feel.
    A §lsign§r on a §lchest§r tends to get in the way when you are §llabeling§r things. This little §5§lWood Label§r is quite handy, as it doesn't§l cover§r the front of the §lChest§r. Open the §linterface§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r it with an §lempty hand§r.
    The §5§lFancy Sign§r is wonderful, you can §lcustomize§r the §ltext§r on it in various ways, and even §ldisplay§r a couple items on it! §l§nSneak + Right Click§r it with an §lempty hand§r to open up the §linterface§r, which §lexplains§r everything.

questDatabase.name: A Hip Style
questDatabase.description:
§5§lGlasses§r... well, they tend to §lfade§r in and out of §lstyle§r, really. Sometimes they are out of §lstyle§r and you should probably wear §lcontacts§r, other times the old school §5§lMonocole§r is best. For us, §5§lGlasses§r are ALWAYS in, as they are quite helpful in §lpointing§r out small things with many of these §ldecorative§r things I'm showing you.
    When §lworn§r, §5§lGlasses§r, §5§lTinted Glasses§r, and §5§lMonocoles§r will pop up §ltext§r of any §litem§r in a §4§lBibliocraft§r block, such as the §lname§r of a§l Book§r in a §lBookcase§r, what §lPotion§r on a §lPotion Shelf§r, etc. 
    You can also make a §5§lMonocole§r for a more §lhigh-brow§r look.
    What better way to show your §lstyle§r than by making something §lunique§r? You'll need a §5§lFraming Saw§r to start with, then you can §lcombine§r it with any kind of §lPlank§r to make §5§lFraming Boards and Sheets§r. You can use §5§lFraming Sheets§r in place of §lWood Planks§r and §5§lFraming Panels§r in place of §lSlabs§r in a recipe to make a §lFramed§r version of the §lfurniture§r. You can then place it into a §5§lFurniture Paneler§r, and design it with almost any §lSolid Block Texture§r.

questDatabase.name: Special Editions
questDatabase.description:
§lBooks§r contain so much §lknowledge§r. They can also contain much, much more! Our §lbookshelves§r can be §lfilled§r with endless §lstorybooks§r and §linstruction manuals§r, but there are a couple of very special §lbooks§r we can fill them with as well, each one doing something §ldifferent§r.
    For when a regular §lBook§r isn't §lbig§r enough or §lfancy§r enough, the §5§lBig Writing Book§r lets you have §lmultiple chapters§r, §lfancy text§r, and much more!
    The §5§lSlotted Book§r looks like a §lsigned book§r and can be §lrenamed§r. Only instead of a §lstory§r, it contains a single item §lslot§r within it.
    When placed in a §lBookcase§r, the §5§lRedstone: Vol 1§r emits a §lRedstone Signal§r at the §lstrength§r of the §lslot§r it's put in. If put in the §lupper left§r, it emits §lno signal§r, but the §llower right§r slot emits §lfull strength§r. Don't forget you can §lrename§r this in an §lAnvil§r!
    If you like §ldrawing maps§r while §lexploring§r, you eventually come to the point where you are holding more §lmaps§r than actual §ltools§r. That's where the §5§lAtlas§r comes in! It can §lhold§r, §ldisplay§r, §lorganize§r, and even §ldraw§r up new §lmaps§r for you! You can also §lenchant§r the §5§lAtlas§r, and if you §ldie§r, you'll §lreappear§r with an §lEternal Compass§r that will §lguide§r you back to your §lstuff§r!

questDatabase.name: Enlightened
questDatabase.description:
Being able to see in the §ldark§r is quite §luseful§r, and we can't all wear fancy night vision §lgoggles§r. They aren't very §lstylish§r anyways. What IS §lstylish§r, though, are §lmetal lamps§r, especially in §lGold§r! All of these §llamps§r look slightly different whether you §lplace§r them on the §lfloor§r, the §lwall§r, or the §lceiling§r. They can also be §lcolored§r various colors§r with a bit of §ldye§r!
    There are two§r §lstyles§r of §llamp§r in §4§lBibliocraft§r, and two§l metals§r you can use : §5§lIron Lamps§r and §5§lIron Lanterns§r or §5§lGold Lamps§r and §5§lGold Lanterns§r.

questDatabase.name: Handy Tools
questDatabase.description:
§lDecorating§r isn't all just §lpainting§r and §lcolor matching§r, a lot of it requires special §ltools§r. Does this §lroo§rm have enough §lspace§r for a §lbed§r? Did we get all the §lfurniture§r we wanted? And §lso§r on and §lso§r on. All these §ltools§r I use §lregularly§r and should be quite §lhelpful§r to you as well!
    The §5§lTape Measure§r helps you §lmeasure distances§r between two points. §l§nRight Click§r it onto the §lfirst block§r, then on the§l second block§r to see how §lfar§r the two are from §leach other§r. You can also §lrotate§r items on §ltables§r with this by §l§nRight Clicking§r it onto one of the §lsides§r of the §ltable§r.
    The §5§lClipboard§r allows you to make multiple lists and §lcheck§r them off. §lHandy§r when you have a §lbig project§r going.
    The §5§lScrew Gu§rn and §5§lHand Drill§r do the same things. They can §lrotate§r most §4§lBibliocraft§r and §4§lVanilla§r blocks when §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r. Many §4§lBibliocraft§r blocks can also be §lchanged§r just by §l§nRight Clicking§r them with one of these §ltools§r.
    Not sure how §ldeep§r that §locean§r is, or how far to the§l ground§r that §ljump§r is? Break out a §5§lPlumb Line§r and find out! Stand right in front of the §ldrop§r you want to measure the §ldepth§r of and §l§nRight Click§r with this item. It'll tell you how far §ldown§r the next §lsolid block§r is.

questDatabase.name: Your Table Awaits
questDatabase.description:
Standing, it's all well and good, but after a while its quite §ltiring§r. Especially if you are trying to do something like... say §leat§r dinner or §lread§r a book§r or §lwrite§r a book§r or... well, lots of §lthings§r! Thankfully you have plenty of §loptions§r for both §lsitting§r and §lworking§r, from §5§lDesks§r and §5§lTables§r to §lchairs§r and §lthrones§r. A wide range of §lstyles§r and §loptions§r to choose from!
    §5§lTables§r are handy for §lplacing§r items on by simply §l§nRight Clicking§r them onto the §5§lTable§r. You can then §lrotate§r them by §l§nRight Clicking§r a §lTape Measure§r on any side of the §5§lTable§r. You can also add a §ltablecloth§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r the §ltop§r with a§l Carpet§r, or add a §lrug§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r the §lsi§ide§r of the §5§lTable§r with the §lCarpet§r. You can remove a§l tablecloth§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r the §ltop§r with a §lScrewgun§r or §lHand Drill§r, and a §lRug§r by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r the side of the §5§lTable§r with a §lScrewgun§r or §lHand Drill§r.
    You can place §lBooks§r down on a §5§lDesk§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r them either on the §lback left or right corners§r to stack them, or the §lcenter§r to place an §lopen book§r. You can grab a §lbook§r by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r with an§l empty hand§r. A §lTypewriter§r set on the desk will automatically stack finished §lBooks§r onto one of the two stacks.
    You can §lupholster§r these §5§lSeats§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r it with a colored §lCarpet§r. You can connect multiple §5§lSeats§r together by holding a §lScrewgun§r or §lHand Drill§r and §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r each one you want to §lconnect§r together. §lRepeat§r the process to §ldisconnect§r them.
    There is a wide array of of §loptions§r when you want to add a §lback§r to your §5§lSeats§r. You can §lrotate§r which way the §lback §ris facing by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r the legs of the §5§lSeat§r with a §lHand Drill§r or §lScrewgun§r. You can §lremove§r the §5§lSeat Back§r and the §lUpholstery§r by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r the top of the §5§lSeat§r.

Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Carpenter's Blocks
questDatabase.description:
You know, in §larchitecture§r, the common §l'style'§r has been §lsquares§r. §lRight angles§r. §lRectangles§r. Anything with a §l90 degree angle§r. §lSteps§r are just small §lstacks§r of §lsquares§r. Even §l'round'§r buildings are made with columns of §lsquare blocks§r, just arranged in a §lcircle§r. Practical, but... §lboring§r. I think we can add a little §lpizzazz§r to any building just by §lembracing§r the §lodd angle§r. 
    It all starts... with a §lsquare§r. Yes, I know, I talk about §langles§r and §lslopes§r, but it all stems from the §lcore§r structure of a §5§lCarpenter's Block§r. §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r form the core of §lexpanding§r our §ldesigns§r!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Carpenter's Tools
questDatabase.description:
Now, those §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r I showed you how to make are§l special§r. You can §l§nRight Click§r any other §lsolid block§r onto it to§l apply §rit as a §lCover§r. §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r, and many other §lblocks§r you can make WITH §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r, like §lCarpenter's Stairs§r, have §lSide Covers§r, which can be placed on §lto§rp of normal §lCovers§r. Each §l'side'§r that can have a §lCover§r can be §lcustomized§r with a different §lblock§r, and further §lcustomized§r with a §lchiseled texture§r if you §l§nRight Click§r a §5§lCarpenter's Chisel§r on it. You can §lremove§r any §lCover§r on a §lblock§r by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r the §lCover§r with a §5§lCarpenter's Hammer§r.
    The §5§lCarpenter's Hammer§r is useful not just for §lremoving Covers§r, but for §lcustomizing§r almost any §lCarpenter's Block§r. By §l§nRight Clicking§r the §5§lCarpenter's Hammer§r on a §lblock§r, you can§l cycle§r through its §l'styles'§r. You can then §lrotate§r the §lblock§r around by §l§nLeft Clicking§r on the §lblock§r with the §5§lCarpenter's Hammer§r.
    Want a §ldesign§r to §lPOP§r more with some §ltexture§r? Take out your §5§lCarpenter's Chisel§r and §l§nLeft or Right Click§r on a §4§lCarpenter's Block§r that has a §lCover§r on it.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: More Construction Options
questDatabase.description:
Now, §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r can be knocked into §lhalf slabs§r with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r, but that can bring your §ldesigns§r only so far, you know? You have a variety of §lstairs§r and §lslops§r you can use as well! Not only that, you can put an §lOverlay§r on many of these blocks! §lOverlays§r add another layer of §ldesign§r to your §lbuilds§r, just §l§nSneak + Right Click§r one of these §litems§r onto the §lblock§r to add it as an §lOverlay§r.
    §lSeed§r for Grass
    §lSnowball§r for Snow
    §lVine§r for Vine
    §lString§r for Web
    §lWheat§r for Hay
    §lMushroom§r for Mycellium§r
    §5§lCarpenter's Stairs§r and §5§lCarpenter's Wedge Slopes§r will §lautomatically§r try to §lorient§r themselves if you §l§nRight Click§r them against the §lface§r of a §4§lCarpenter's Block§r. If this orients them §loddly§r, you can hold §l§nSneak§r when §l§nRight Clicking§r to §lprevent§r this. §5§lSlopes§r have a wide variety of §ldesigns§r. You can §lcycle§r through them after placing them with a§l Carpenter's Hammer§r like usual, but you can also §lhold§r them in your §lhand§r, hold §l§nSneak§r and use your §l§nMouse Wheel§r to §lcycle§r through them.
    Want finer §lcontrol§r of the §lslopes§r? Place down some of these §5§lCollapsible Blocks§r and §l§nRight Click§r a §lcorner§r or §lquadrant§r to §llower§r it, or §l§nLeft Click§r to §lraise§r it. It'll try to keep an even§l transition§r between §lblocks§r, but you can hold §l§nSneak§r when raising or lowering a block to§l ignore§r this ability.
    §5§lCarpenter's Barriers§r will automatically create posts at §lintersections§r and §lcorners§r, and you can §lforce§r a post §lconnection§r by §l§nLeft Clicking§r the §5§lBarrier§r with your §lCarpenter's Hammer§r. You can §lcycle §rthrough fence §lstyles§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r with your §lCarpenter'sHammer§r, but the normal §lFence§r style can have the §lboard depth§r changed by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r with your §lCarpenter's Hammer§r.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Quite Accessable
questDatabase.description:
Now, it wouldn't be much of a§l home§r if we couldn't get into it, now would it? Nor would it be §lstylish§r if we couldn't make these things match current trends either! Just like §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r, §lSlopes§r, §lStairs§r, etc, you can place §lCovers§r on these to §lcustomize§r them!
    §l§nLeft or Right Click§r a §5§lCarpenter's Door§r with your §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to §lcycle§r through the different door §lstyles§r. You can also §l§nSneak + Right Click§r to switch between §lWood§r and §lIron Door§r behaviour. If you switch to §lIron Door§r behaviour, it will require a §lRedstone Signal§r to §lopen§r.
    A §5§lGarage Door§r needs to be placed§l underneath §ra §lsolid block§r, where it will then §lextend§r down to the §lfloor§r. If you open a §5§lGarage Door§r and there are other §5§lGarage Doors§r next to it, all of them will §lopen§r at the §lsame time§r.
    Just like the §5§lCarpenter's Door§r, §l§nRight or Left Click§r a §5§lCarpenter's Hatch§r or with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to cycle §lstyles§r. You can also make a §5§lCarpenter's Ladder§r.
    Similar to §lCarpenter's Barriers§r, §l§nRight Click§r the §5§lCarpenter's Gate§r with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to cycle §lstyles§r, or §l§nSneak + Right Click§r the normal §lgate§r style to change its §lplank depth§r.
    §l§nLeft Click§r on the§5§l Carpenter's Pressure Plate§r with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to switch §lRedstone Polarity§r (whether it emits a §lsignal§r when something is or is not on it). §l§nRight Click§r with the §lCarpenter'sHammer§r to change what §ltriggers§r the §5§lPressure Plate§r : either §lplayers§r, §lanimals§r, §lmonsters§r, or §leverything§r. The §5§lPressure Plate§r can also be placed on any §lside§r of a§l block§r.
    §l§nLeft Click §reither the§5§l Carpenter's Button§r or §5§lCarpenter's Lever§r with your §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to switch the §lPolarity§r of the §lRedstone Signal§r. You can §lplace§r either of these on any §lside§r of a §lblock§r as well.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Quite Homey
questDatabase.description:
Nothing makes a house a home more than §ldecorating§r it to your own §lstyle§r. Your own §lbed§r, a pretty §lflower§r in a beautiful §lflowerpot§r, wall to wall eye catching §ldesigns§r, there are plenty of ways to give something your §lpersonal§r touch. Did you know you can also add §lDyes§r to most §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r as well? Take normal §4§lVanilla§r §lDye§r powder, and §l§nSneak + Right Click §rthe §lDye§r onto the §lCarpenter's Block§r. §l§nSneak + Left Click§r with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to get the §lDye§r back.
    Cycle between §5§lCarpenter's Torch§r styles by §l§nRight Clicking§r with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r. The §luncovered style§r will randomly §lextinguish§r if it is out in the§l rain§r. You can either §lrelight§r it with another §5§lTorch§r, or wait until the §lrain§r stops and it will §lreignite§r itself.
    §l§nLeft Click§r the §5§lCarpenter's Daylight Sensor§r with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to change §lRedstone Polarity§r. §l§nRight Click§r to change when the §5§lSensor§r will §ltrigger§r : §lPlayer Sleep§r (when it gets §ldark§r enough to §lsleep§r or §llight§r enough to §lwake§r), §lMonster Spawn§r (When the §llight§r enters or exits the §llevel§r where §lmonsters§r would §lspawn§r), or §lSun Exposure§r (§lRedstone output§r depending on §lorientation§r of the §lsun§r compared to the §lorientation§r of the §5§lSensor§r). You can place the §5§lSensor§r on the §lside§r of a §lblock§r, but it will be §lless sensitive§r to the §llight§r.
    You can§l plant§r most things in the §5§lCarpenter's Flower Pot§r. §l§nRight Click§r inside the §5§lPot§r to place §lsoil§r, then §l§nRight Click§r a §lseed§r on the §5§lPot§r to §lplant§r it. You can §l§nSneak + Right Click§r the §lplant§r to §lremove§r it, then the §lSoil§r to §lremove§r it as well. You can §l§nSneak + Right Click§r to §lremove §rthe §lCover§r. §l§nLeft or Right Click§r the §5§lPot§r with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to §lcycle§r through §ldesigns§r (You §lcannot§r have both a §lDesign§r and a §lCover§r). You can also §lFertilize§r some §lplants§r with §lBone Meal§r, where they will take on a lively §lgreen§  color§r.
    To §lDye§r the frame of the §5§lCarpenter's Bed§r, apply it to the §lHead§r of the §5§lBed§r. To §lDye§r the §lBlanket§r, apply it to the §lFoot§r of the §5§lBed§r. If just §lcoloring§r the §lBlanket§r isn't enough, §l§nLeft or Right Click§r on it with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r to §lcycle§r through some §ldesigns§r!
    You can §lremove§r a §5§lCarpenter's Tile§r by §l§nSneak + Left Clicking§r them with a §lCarpenter's Hammer§r. §l§nLeft or Right Click§r them normally with the §lHammer§r to §lcycle§r through §ldesigns§r, then §l§nSneak + Right Click§r them to §lrotate§r the §ldesign§r. Unlike other §4§lCarpenter's Blocks§r, §lDyes§r used on §5§lTiles§r will not be §lconsumed§r.
    With your §lCarpenter's Hammer§r, §l§nRight Click§r a §5§lCarpenter's Safe§r to set whether §lPipes§r or similar §lItem Transport§r methods can §lextract§r or §linput§r items. §l§nSneak + Right Click§r to §lLock§r or §lUnlock§r the §5§lSafe§r. When §llocked§r, the §llight§r on the front turns §lRed§r, and only you and §3§lserver operators§r will be able to §lopen§r or §lbreak§r the §5§lSafe§r. The §lblue light strip§r designates what §lpercentage§r of slots are used. You can §lupgrade§r the §lcapacity§r by holding a §lGold Ingot§r, an §lEmerald§r, or a §lDiamond§r and §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r the §5§lSafe§r.

questDatabase.name: Malisis' Doors

Plain§l wood§r and §lmetal doors§r are so... §lplain§r. And §lboring§r. We have so many §lstylish§r options for §lwalls§r, §lceilings§r, §lfloors§r, §lfurniture§r, why not §ldoors§r as well? As much as I §lposture§r about being §leye catching§r and §lunique§r, there still is a place for §lold school§r, reliable §ldesigns§r, with perhaps a little §ltwist§r. As long as they fit the §ldesign§r of the rest of the building, that is. It'd be quite §lsilly§r to have an old §lwooden door§r be the way into a §lhigh-tech laboratory§r, after all!
    §5§lIron§r and §5§lWooden Glass Doors§r work just like their normal §lwood§r and §liron§r counterparts, but instead of §lrotating§r on a §lhinge§r, they §lslide§r into the §lwall§r next to them! §5§lShoji Doors§r are much like the §lsliding§r ones, except they slide §lopen§r and §lclose§r much §lslower§r.

    The §5§lGarage Door§r can be §lany size§r, as long as all the pieces are §lfacing§r the §lsame§r way. When you apply a §lRedstone Signal§r to any part of it, the §lentire§r door will §lslide upward§r as a §lsingle unit§r.

There's something to be said about really §latmospheric§r builds. Using modern §lmaterials§r to build some sort of §lthemed§r creation, making the outside of your house look like a §lsubmarine§r or a §llighthouse§r or some super §lfuturistic fortress§r. Using a §lnormal§r door just wouldn't cut it for these. 
    This §5§lRusty Hatch§r comes complete with its own §5§lRusty Ladders§r! It takes a lot of §lspace§r, though, as you need§l room§r for the giant door to §lopen§r. If you place it on the §ltop half§r of a block side, it'll open §lupwards§r. If you need to extend the §lladder§r of the §5§lRusty Hatch§r, or just want a more §latmospheric§r ladder, you can make more §5§lRusty Ladders§r.

questDatabase.description:
There are a lot of different styles of §ldoors§r for you to choose from, but sometimes none of them fit your§l decor§r just right. With the §5§lDoor Factory§r, you can §lmix§r blocks together to make a §lcustom door§r, selecting the §lmaterial§r for the §lframe§r and the §ldoor§r itself. You can also choose how it §lopens§r, what §lsounds§r it makes, and more! Perhaps, though, you also want to §lcustomize§r your blocks? With the §5§lBlock Mixer§r, you can §lblend§r two blocks together.  With both of these, you can use a §lBucket of Water§r or a §lBucket of Lava§r to have a 'flowing' §ltexture§r of that §lliquid§r. You can also use an §lEnder Pearl§r to show a swirling §lPortal§r, or you can use a §lFlint and Steel§r to have a §lfire effect§r on the §ldoor§r as well.
    When §lmixing§r blocks, if the block emits §llight§r, the custom block will too. §lMixing§r in a §lRedstone Block§r will have it emit §lredstone§r. §lNon-opaque§r blocks like §lglass§r will make the block §lsee-through§r.

questDatabase.name: Here and Gone Again
questDatabase.description:
Sometimes, you want a §ldoor§r that's just §ldifferent§r. Whether its a heavy solid §ldoor§r flush with the rest of the §lwall§r, or a §ldoor§r that looks just like the §lwall§r itself, §lhiding your entrance§r so only you know where it is, you have a lot of §loptions§r with §5§lVanishing Frames§r! Once placed, you can §l§nRight Click§r any §lblock§r onto the §5§lVanishing Frame§r to §lcopy§r its looks. When a §lRedstone Signal§r is applied to one, it will §lpropogate§r the §lsignal§r to all connected §5§lVanishing Frames§r, though in §ldifferent§r ways depending on what type of §5§lVanishing Frame§r you've got.
    The §5§lWooden Vanishing Frame§r will transmit the §lRedstone Signal§r to§l neighboring frames§r of all types.
    The §5§lIron Vanishing Frame§r will only propogate the §lRedstone Signal§r to other §5§lVanishing Frames§r that are §lcopying§r the same block.
    §5§lGold Vanishing Frames§r are like§l Iron§r, but will only propogate the §lsignal§r to §lframes§r with the §lsame Block and Metadata§r. This means If you §lactivate§r one that looks like §lWhite Wool§r, it §lwon't§r send the signal to one that looks like §lGreen Wool§r.
    §5§lDiamond Vanishing Frames§r let you §lcustomize§r all these §lbehaviours§r, even include a §ldelay§r before it propogates§ the §lRedstone Signal§r!

    With a simple §5§lChisel§r and an eye for §ldecoration§r, you can turn lots of simple, many times boring, §lmaterials§r into spectacular, §leye catching§r fancies! All you need is your §5§lChisel§r and a stack of §lmaterials§r!

You can put a wide variety of §lblocks§r in the §lleft side§r, to see what you can turn them into in the §lright§r.     Thread some §lString§r in §lWool§r to make §5§lCarpet§r. The outside edges of placed §5§lCarpet§r will have a different design than the §lcenter§r. You can combine two §5§lCarpet§r to make a §5§lFloor Carpet§r, also known as a §lRug§r.

There's a few ways you can §lspruce§r up a §lbuild§r that doesn't involve taking your §4§lChisel§r to it. These three '§ltoys§r' are quite different from each other, but be §lcareful§r with them all the same!
    §lBottling§r some §lQuartz§r in §lGlass§r gets you a §5§lCloud in a Bottle§r. You can §l§nRight Click§r it to §lthrow§r it, and where it hits §lspawns§r a big, fluffy §lcloud§r! It is the only way to get special §lCloud§r blocks to §4§lChisel§r.
    By wrapping §lVines§r and §lSticks§r together, you get a §5§lBall of Moss§r. When §l§nRight Clicked§r to throw it, any §lCobblestone§r the splash hits will be covered in §lMoss§r.
    Combining a §lStone Pickaxe§r and §lShovel§r and putting them in a §lGlass Bottle§r (don't ask how!), you get a §5§lSmashing Rock§r you can §lthrow§r that will smash §lStone§r to §lCobble§r, §lCobble§r to §lGravel§r, and §lGravel§r to §lSand§r.

questDatabase.name: A Custom Fantasy
questDatabase.description:
What if I told you that you could §4§lChisel§r your way to a more §lfantastical§r life? Well, you can at least §4§lChisel§r yourself a nice §lFantasy§r setting. Your §limagination§r is the limit with all these §ldesigns§r you can just picture being from stalwart §ldwarves§r, elegant §lelves§r, and §lmad overlords§r.
    Surrounding a §lGold Nugget§r with §lStone§r gets you this §lwhite marble§r and §lgold inlaid§r block. These §5§lPurpled Fantasy Blocks§r are great for princely §lcastles§r.
    If your §ldesigns§r are less §lflashy§r and more §lspiritual§r, look no further than the §5§lTemple Block§r, obtainable by surrounding some §lBlue Dye§r with §lStone§r.
    By surrounding a §lBucket of Water§r with some §lStone§r, you get some quite §lelemental§r looking §5§lWaterstone§r. §5§lLavastone§r can be made the same way, but with a§l Bucket of Lava§r instead.
    If §lopposing elements§r isn't your §lfantasy§r, then how about the §ldivine struggle§r? Surrounding a§l Feather§r with §lStone§r gets you §5§lHolystone§r, while surrounding some §lCoal§r gets you §5§lGrimstone§r.
    Beyond this §lmortal§r plane is the §lVoid§r. Surrounding an §lEnder Pearl§r with §lObsidian§r and §lStone§r nets you the §lfantastically§r mesmerizing §5§lVoidstone§r.

    By smelting §lGravel§r, you can make §5§lConcrete§r. This is fantasic §lmaterial§r for both §lwalkways§r and §lroadways§r. And what is a proper §lroad§r without proper §llines§r? Mix some §lRedstone§r with some §lWhite Dye§r to make an eye-catching §5§lRoad Line§r.

questDatabase.name: Improved Chisel Tools

Your basic §lIron Chisel§r is great and all, but it eventually §lwears out§r. Not to mention, if you are making a BIG §lconstruction§r, thats a whole §llot§r of things you need to §4§lChisel§r. By §lhand§r. My fingers §lhurt§r just thinking about it! Well, here's a set of advanced §ltools§r that should really help you out!
    The §5§lDiamond Chisel§r has a few distinct §ladvantages§r. One, it lasts §llonger§r, thats for sure. Two, you can change §lModes§r on it to §4§lChisel §r§llarger§r amounts of §lplaced blocks§r at once!
    The §5§lAuto Chisel§r does what it says on the §ltin§r. You can place a §lChisel§r into it, a basic §lmaterial§r, and the §lChiseled variation§r you want, and it'll slowly, steadily §4§lChisel§r them for you! 
    You can also put some §lUpgrades§r into it. The §5§lSpeed Upgrade§r speeds up how fast the §5§lAuto Chisel§r works. The §5§lAutomation Upgrade§r allows you to §lpipe§r items in and out of the §5§lAuto Chisel§r, via §lPipes§r or other §ltransportation§r methods. The §5§lStack Upgrade§r makes the §5§lAuto Chisel§r work on entire §lstacks§r of §lmaterials§r at once!

questDatabase.name: A Custom Workplace
questDatabase.description:
How truely §lefficient§r is a §lworkplace§r if it doesn't look and feel like a §lfantastic§r place to spend a §lthird§r of your day in? Not that §lefficient§r, I'd say! If your §lworkplace§r looks like every other §lconcrete§r and §lwood§r, cookie cutter §lbox§r, then how can you put §lmaximum§r effort into your job? Well, you can §4§lChisel§r your way to a §lnicer§r work §lenvironment§r!
    §lLaboratories§r are well known for their §lpristine§r, uniform §lwalls§r that are easy to clean and maintain. Surrounding some§l Quartz§r with §lStone§r will give us this §lclean§r look with the §5§lLaboratory Block§r.
    Looking for something less §lfuturistic§r and a little more §lmodern§r? Combining §lStone§r and§l Iron§r nets you a §5§lTechnical Block§r, complete with §lgiant fans§r, §lwires§r, and more. Switching a bit of §lStone§r for §lGlass§r, you can make some §5§lTransparent Technical Blocks§r.
    If you want to go back a bit to the rise of §lIndustry§r, look no further than the §5§lFactory Block§r. A little less §lStone§r, and you have more §lrustic§r looking §lmetal§r parts!
    Go §lBack§r to the §5§lFutura Block§r by surrounded §lRedstone§r with §lStone§r.
    For that futuristic §lArmored§r look, the §5§lTyrian Block§r gives you lots of options. Just surround an §lIron Bar§r with §lStone§r. Another §lFuturistic§r look is to go §lHexagonal§r. By surrounding a §lCoal Block§r with §lStone§r, you get §5§lHex Plating§r that looks amazingly §lfuturistic§r.
    Need to §llight§r an area to §lsee§r in, but not, you know... ACTUALLY §llight§r it? Well, surround some §lGlowstone Dust§r with §lStone§r and you'll get an §5§lAnti Block§r. It §lilluminates§r very brightly... but only §litself§r. If you put it in a §lpitch black§r room, you can see only it §lclearly§r... and anything else that §lwalks§r between you and it. You could probably use this for a §lgreenscreen§r!

questDatabase.name: Somewhat Dislocated
questDatabase.description:
With the research into teleportation and the Dislocation Charm continuing, we looked into ways to mount the Charm into a machine, as well as other ways to teleport and distort reality. 
    First, we wanted a way to teleport to a destination saved in the Disloaction Charm, but leave the Charm behind for others to use, and we've succeeded in making a... well, a magical pedastal for your Dislocation Charms. The bonus of using the Dislocation Pedastal is that it will not consume charges on your Charms. If you rename the basic Charm in an Anvil, or have a destination set with the Enhanced version, it will display the name of the location above the Pedastal when you place the Charm in it.
    The second thing we discovered is that we could replace the head of an Arrow with an Ender Pearl, but it can only be fired with one of the Draconic Bows. It also is a whole lot more dangerous... bring some safe falling gear at minimum...
    The final thing we've learned is how to make a Draconic Flame, which seems to distort whatever its placed against, allowing us to peer through it like a magic mirror.

questDatabase.name: DecoCraft

There are a lot of things that make a house a §lhome§r, or a workplace a §lbusiness§r, or a lab a §llaboratory§r. To me, its the little §ltouches§r that matter. A §lkid's room§r doesn't seem fun without some §lstuffed animals§r, nor does a lab look §lscientific§r without some §lbeakers§r, right? 
    Well, you can make all these little §laccroutements§r from a simple §lmaterial§r called §5§lCrafting Clay§r! A little §lSand§r, a little §lDirt§r, and some §lGreen§r, §lRed§r, or §lBlue Dye§r is all you need! Even §lMonsters§r seem to §llove§r it, it can §ldrop§r from many different §lcreatures§r!
    Now that you have some §lmaterials§r to work with, you'll need to make yourself a §5§lDecoBench§r! The §5§lDecoBench§r can be §lfilled§r with large amounts §5§lRed, Blue, and Green Crafting Clay§r, or even filled with basic §lClay§r and §lDye§r. You can then easily §lsearch§r and §lcraft§r any of the §lhundreds§r of §4§lDecoCraft§r items!

questDatabase.description: §lHolidays§r and §lcelebrations§r are a great time and a perfect excuse to go all out with §ldecorations§r!

Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Ender Storage
questDatabase.description:
Your world has presented the whole of The Ferret Business with new things to research and examine, and the lab I'm from is no exception. Engineer Erin is very intrigued, I'm not sure if you've talked to him yet, but I myself have tinkered with some new Storage designs, and have come up with something fantastic. 
    Using Blaze Rods to power some Ender Pearls, I've discovered a way to make containers that are able to connect to the same 'dimensional' area. By dyeing the three bars atop both containers to the same 'color key', they will both share the same inventory, no matter how far away they were from each other! Right click a dye on any of the three pips on top of the Ender Chest. When you break the chest, it will remember this key!
    Want more security? You can also Right Click a Diamond onto the latch to lock that Chest to you. If you had a Red-White-Blue chest, anyone with the same combination accesses that space. If you add a Diamond, it acts like a fourth combination with your name. Your Red-White-Blue Diamond'd chest will only access other chests you've locked with a Diamond. Anyone can OPEN your Diamond Locked chest, keep in mind, but it keeps someone from randomly cycling through colors to find waiting items.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Pouch Perfect
questDatabase.description:
I love these Ender Chests. It makes supplying other parts of The Ferret Business much easier for everyone involved. The only problem? The Ender Chest is heavy and can only be opened when its set in place. 
    Now, I had an idea. I'll admit, it was spawned after a session of Dungeons and Dragons, but I feel it IS pretty sound. Taking the same concept as the Ender Chest, except in portable Ender Pouch form. Reach into the bag, pull out anything in one of the chests keyed to the same colors! Bam, modern Bag of Holding! Now, you'll need a chest set to the key you want first, you can't color this on the go unfortunately.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Long Distance Liquid
questDatabase.description:
Solid items and container storage is fantastic, yet a lot of what we deal with is also liquid transport. Using the same concept as the Chest, I've come up with a liquid Ender Tank that works just like it. 
    The dial on the front has a blue side and an orange side. When blue is upward, it will accept liquids being pumped into it. When orange is up, it will pump liquid out on its own. The same color code on an Ender Tank won't connect to an Ender Chest, as that'd just silly. 
    And quite messy. 
    You can lock an Ender Tank just like you can an Ender Chest. You can also flip the dial remotely by sending a Redstone Signal to the tank. When the signal stops, the dial will flip back.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Iron Chest
questDatabase.description:
A quite standard set of storage methods we like to employ are simple Chests. We make them with various materials, allowing us to make them bigger and better, able to store all of your goods! The first Chest, though, is not of Iron, but... of Dirt. The most amazing Chest of all, able to fulfill all your inventory needs!
    The DirtChest 9000! is a little joke Engineer Erin likes to play on new Assistants. I, as a Stockmaster, must uphold this tradition. The Dirt Chest holds only one stack of items. Not much... but still amusing.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Of Copper and Iron
questDatabase.description:
Jokes aside, Wooden Chests are quite servicable in their own right, but quickly become cramped and full. Even Double Chests fill up quite fast, and with you all alone, I figure you'll be storing everything you can to survive. Given that, the first two chests I will show you are an excellent start in improving your storage capacity.
    The Copper Chest has a little more room in it than a basic Wooden Chest. The Iron Chest has the same amount of room a Double Wooden Chest does.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Of Silver and Gold
questDatabase.description:
Now that you've doubled the capacity of a single Wooden Chest, it's time to expand even further. By taking more precious metals such as Silver and Gold, we can increase the space in each Chest even more!
    Silver is a very pretty material, and it also makes excellent Silver Chests. The next step up is the Gold Chest. Not only does it have more storage space than Silver, it's also a great way to display your wealth!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Of Diamond, Crystal, and Dark
questDatabase.description:
Going beyond the precious metals, we can look to perfecting the structure of the Chest itself to maximize our Storage potential. What better way than with Diamonds and Glass? And perhaps, some other, less obvious ways?
    While fairly expensive, for the price, the Diamond Chest gets you a lot of bang for your buck. With the most storage space in it of the Iron Chest line, you'll be hard pressed to fill a bunch of these. Or will you? It always seems like there is never enough room.
    Ever wanted to see what was in a Diamond Chest without, you know, opening it? Well, with a bit of glass, you can do just that with the §5§lCrystal Chest§r!
    If your normal §5§lDiamond Chests§r seem a bit too... §lfragile§r, you can use the §lstrength§r of §lObsidian§r to §lfortify§r one! It'll §lwithstand§r some pretty §lstrong blasts§r, but don't skimp on the§l insurance§r for your §5§lObsidian Chest§r if you're playing with §lNukes§r...

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Upgrading Success
questDatabase.description: The beauty of the §4§lIron Chest§r system is that it enables you to §lupgrade§r chests §lwithout having to empty them§r and pick them back up. By crafting an §5§lUpgrade§r instead of the next §lchest§r up, you can §l§nSneak + Right Click§r the §lupgrade§r on the appropriate §lchest§r to... well... §lupgrade§r it!

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Open Modular Turrets
questDatabase.description:
Finding a place to store all your belongings is §leasy§r. §lDefending§r it when all sorts of §lterrors of the night§r want your §lbrains§r? Well, thats a bit more §ldifficult§r. Theres a lot of ways to §ldefend§r yourself and §lfight§r the §lcreatures of the dark§r, but there is only one of you, and§l hundreds§r of them. 
    What you need... is §lsuperior firepower§r. Something that can be adjusted to fit the needs of your growing §lbase§r. For §lmilitary§r and §ldefense§r applications, §3§lThe Ferret Business§r prefers to employ §4§lOpen Modular Turrets§r. As long as you §lsupply§r enough §lRF Energy§r and §lAmmo§r, they will §ldefend§r your §lbelongings§r tirelessly. With a wide variety of§l options§r, you can surely find something that will meet your §ldefense§r needs!
    These consist of §lBases§r that can be supplied§l Ammo§r and §lRF Energy§r, and §lTurrets§r that you can §lattach§r to §lany side§r. The §lTurret Bases§r can be accessed by §l§nRight Clicking§r them with an§l open hand§r. If you §l§nRight Click§r them with any simple §lblock§r, you will §ldisguise§r the §lTurret Base§r.
    Most §lBases§r are made with §5§lSensors§r, which are used to §lidentify targets§r. Most §lturrets§r have a §5§lBarrel§r and §5§lChamber§r as well as a §5§lSensor§r, so that each one can target §ldifferent enemies§r at once.
    The §5§lTurret Base (Tier 1)§r can only be §lpowered§r by the §5§lBasic Turret Base Crank§r. Any other §lside §rthat is not being §lpowered§r (whether by a §5§lCrank§r or by some other §lRF Energy pipe§r) can have a §lTurret§r on it. To attach the §5§lCrank§r to the §5§lTurret Base (Tier 1)§r, you will need to §l§nSneak + Right Click§r the §5§lCrank§r onto the §5§lWooden Turret Base§r.
    The §5§lDisposable Item Turret§r  will §lfire ANY item§r you put into the §5§lTurret Base§r §lammo pool§r. Due to the high energy and velocity §litem§rs are§l shot§r at, they will be §ldestroyed§r. For a little more §loomph§r in your §lshots§r, you can use a §5§lPotato Launcher Turret§r. Instead of consuming any §ljunk§r laying around, it is specially formed to §lfire§r nothing but §lPotatoes§r.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Expansion Perfection
questDatabase.description:
Seldom will you use all six sides of a §lTurret Base§r. You'll use at least one for §lPower§r, one as a connection point to the §lfloor§r or §lwall§r, and a handful of §lTurrets§r.
    The use of §lExpanders§r on these §lunused sides§r allows you to increase the §lAmmo Storage§r and §lRF Energy Storage§r of a §lTurret Base§r. §5§lPower Expanders§r simply add more §lRF Energy Capacity§r, while §5§lInventory Expanders§r add §l9§r more slots of §lInventory§r, but the limit of §lStack Size§r depends on the §lTier§r of §lExpander§r. 
    §lTier 1§r adds either §l250 RF Capacity§r or Inventory §lMax Stack Size§r of §l4§r.
    §lTier 2§r adds either §l25,000 RF Capacity§r or Inventory §lMax Stack Size§r of §l8§r.
    §lTier 3§r adds either §l75,000 RF Capacity§r or Inventory §lMax Stack Size§r of §l16§r.
    §lTier 4§r adds either §l250,000 RF Capacity§r or Inventory §lMax Stack Size§r of §l32§r.
    §lTier 5§r adds either §l5,000,000 RF Capacity§r or Inventory §lMax Stack Size§r of §l64§r.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 - Burning Bullets
questDatabase.description:
Now, if you don't want to spend most of your time§l cranking§r the wind up §lJack in the Gunbox§r, you'll want to §lupgrade§r your §lfirepower§r pretty quick. Every §lhigher tier base§r can be §lconnected§r to §lRF Energy pipes§r of any sort, such as §lDucts§r or §lConduits§r. You can also §lpipe§r in §lammo§r this way as well.
    Upgrading the §5§lSensor§r allows better §ltargetting§r, and using §lbetter materials§r provides more §lpower§r. With the improvement of §lmaterials§r, we'll also need to make §5§lIO Bus§r. Something good to remember is that a §lRedstone Signal§r will §ldeactivate§r a §lTurret§r.
    The next tier of §lTurret Base§r is the §5§lTurret Base (Tier 2)§r. 
    The §5§lMachine Gun Turret§r will only fire §5§lBullets§r. What it §llacks§r for in §lsingle shot damage§r it makes up for by sheer §lvolume§r. The §5§lIncendiary Turret§r will fire §5§lBurning Clay§r, which §lexplodes§r when it §lhits§r and §llights§r things on §lfire§r. Be careful!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Upgrading Potential
questDatabase.description:
All §lTurret Bases§r beyond §lTier 1§r can be §laugmented§r in various ways. One way is to §ladd an Upgrade§r or two to them. These usually§l increase§r one of the §lstats§r of the connected §lTurrets§r, whether it §lincrease§r their §lrange§r or §ldecrease§r how much §lpower§r each §lshot§r takes. All §lUpgrades§r can be §lstacked multiple times§r.
    The §5§lAccuracy Upgrade§r will §lincrease§r each §lturret's accuracy§r by §l20 percent§r.
    The §5§lEfficiency Upgrade§r will §ldecrease§r how much §lRF Energy§r every §lshot§r will take by §l8 percent§r per §lUpgrade§r.
    §5§lFire Rate Upgrade§r will increase how §lfast§r your turrets §lfire§r by §l10 percent§r per §lupgrade§r.
    Each §5§lRange Upgrade§r will §ladd 2§r more blocks of §lrange§r to your §lTurrets§r.
    §5§lScattershot Upgrade§r adds §ltwo projectiles per shot§r and takes §ltwo more ammo§r each §lshot§r as well. The turret's §lacuracy is decreased§r as well, and it takes more §lRF Energy§r to §lfire§r.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Additional Power
questDatabase.description:
§lAddons§r are a bit more costly than §lUpgrades§r, but do fairly §ldifferent§r things. Generally, each §lbase§r can only take one §lAddon§r until you get to the §lTier 5 Base§r.
    The§5§l Damage Boost Addon§r will §ladd 2 damage§r to §levery shot§r.
    The §5§lSolar Addon§r will allow your §lTurret Base§r to generate §lRF Energy§r if it is out in the §lsunlight§r.
    The §5§lRedstone Reactor§r will allow your §lTurret§r to §lconsume Redstone Dust§r to §lgenerate power§r.
    The §5§lTurret Concealer Addon§r will allow your §lTurrets§r to §lhide§r in their§l base§r when not §ltargetting§r an §lenemy§r.
    The §5§lRecycle Addon§r gives your §lTurrets§r a small §lchance§r of not only §lconsuming no ammo§r each shot, but also §lgenerating§r more.
    You can add a §5§lSerial Port§r to your §lTurret Base§r, which will make it §lcompatible§r with §4§lOpen Computers§r and §4§lComputerCraft§r. How to use this §lfunctionality§r I'm not sure, but there should be some sort of §lmanual§r I would hope.
    §lTechnological advances§r aren't the only thing your §lTurrets§r can use for §lpower§r. The §5§lEssentia Converter§r will take §lThaumcraft Essentia§r and use it like §lRF Energy§r to §mpower§r the §lTurret§r. §lOrdo Essentia§r provides §l10x boost§r in §lpower§r.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 - Boom and Doom
questDatabase.description:
Now, a§l hail of bullets§r are good for §lsmaller monsters§r, but you seem to have some much §lbigger fish§r that want to §lfry§r you. §lBigger firepower§r requires §lbigger power reserves§r though, so you'll need a §lbetter base§r, such as the §5§lTurret Base (Tier 3)§r. This will also give you much better options in §ldealing with hostiles§r, ones that don't involve just §lshooting§r them...
    The §5§lGrenade Launcher§r will launch... bare with me now... §5§lGrenades§r. These §5§lGrenades§r will §lnot damage your home§r, they are specially formulated to damage any §lcreature§r... and this includes §lyou and your Assistants§r, keep in mind. They will hit a §llarge area§r, but the §lcavaet§r is that they take a §lfew seconds§r to§l prime§r and §lexplode§r after landing.
    The §5§lRealitivistic Turret§r won't shoot §lprojectiles§r at your §ltargets§r... instead, it will §lhighlight§r them for you with a §lcloudy effect§r. It may also make them §lweaker§r, but this is a brand new §lturret§r and does not have a §lmanual§r yet.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 - Whoosh and Fwoosh
questDatabase.description:
If §lrolling grenades§r and waiting for §lfuses§r isn't your thing, but §lbig explosions§r are, then the next §lTier§r up is exactly what you are looking for, the §5§lTurret Base (Tier 4)§r! §lDiamonds§r and §lQuartz§r add even more §lpower§r and §lability§r to the §lTurret§r designs.
    The §5§lRocket Launcher Turret§r is one of the most §laccurate Turrets§r but it §lfires§r somewhat §lslowly§r. The §5§lTeleporter Turret§r doesn't attack enemies directly. Instead it will §lteleport§r them to the §lTurret§r, allowing you to do§l more§r than just §lkill§r them.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 - Zap Pow
questDatabase.description:
If the lower §lTiers§r are just not enough§l Firepower§r, say if you were §lassaulting§r some §lDeep, Dark§r fortress of §lhostility§r, then you'll need §levery shot§r to hit like a §lMach Truck§r. I have not one, but TWO §lTurrets§r that can help you out here. Keep in mind, though, that with §lgreat Power§r comes great §lPower Consumption§r. You'll need the §5§lTurret Base (Tier 5)§r for these as well, as its the only one that can have two §lUpgrades§r and two §lAddons§r at the §lsame time§r.
    The §5§lRail Gun Turret§r is the §lslowest firing Turret§r, but every shot hits §lhard§r and §lprecise§r with its §5§lFerro-Magnetic Slug§r. If you are tired of mass producing §lAmmo§r for your §lTurrets§r and have a ton of spare§l RF Energy§r, why not invest in a §5§lLaser Turret§r?

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: JABBA
questDatabase.description:
Here at §3§lThe Ferret Business§r, we §lstockpile lots§r and lots of the §lsame thing§r. Hundreds of §lgemstones§r. Thousands of §lmetal ingots§r. All manner of §lelectonic components§r. 
    Now, placing them into lots of §lchests§r and§l storage boxes§r is all well and good, but it §lwastes§r their potential of §lholding§r more than §lone kind of item§r. Plus, even the §llargest chest§r has a §llimit§r, and you can also accidently §lplace§r the §lwrong item§r into it. 
    This is where §5§lBetter Barrels§r come in. §4§lJABBA§r §5§lBarrels§r, that is! §lEach§r one holds only §lone kind§r of §litem§r, but can be §lupgraded§r and §lcustomized§r in so many §ldifferent§r ways! 
   After §lplacing§r the §5§lBetter Barrel§r, you can §ladd an item§r by §l§nRight Clicking§r it onto the §5§lBetter Barrel§r. Now only THAT §litem§r can be §lput§r into the §5§lBetter Barrel§r.
    You can §ladd all§r of a §lheld item§r into a §5§lBetter Barrel§r by §l§nDouble Right Clicking§r. To §lremove a stack§r of items, §l§nLeft Click§r. To §lremove§r a §lsingle§r one by §l§nSneak + Left Clicking§r.
    You can §llock§r or §lunlock§r a §5§lBetter Barrel§r to an §litem§r by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r it with an§l empty hand§r. This makes it so you can §lempty§r the §5§lBetter Barrel§r, but it will still only §laccept§r§  that §litem§r.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Barrel Improvement
questDatabase.description:
Now, you may have noticed that a normal §lBetter Barrel§r can only hold §l64 stacks§r of an item. Seems like a §llot§r, right? Until you realize that a §ldouble wooden chest§r holds much more than that... but thats where §lUpgrades§r come in!
    But to start §lupgrading§r our §lBarrels§r, we'll have to §lincrease §rthe number of "§lSlots§r" a §lBarrel§r has.  Every §lBarrel§r can only have a certain number of §lSlots§r, and every §lupgrade§r takes up §lSlots§r.
    To §ladd slots§r, we need to start with §5§lStructural Upgrades§r. These are made of varying §lmaterials§r, each one adding more §lSlots§r to the §lBarrel§r. To add any §lupgrade§r like the §5§lStructural Upgrades§r, §l§nSneak + Right Click§r it onto the §lBarrel§r. To use higher tier §5§lStructural Upgrades§r, you must §linstall§r the §llower tier§r first.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Better Storage
questDatabase.description:
One of the §limprovements§r you can make to a §lBarrel§r is to§l increase§r its §lStorage§r capacity. Each one takes a number of §lSlots§r, and adds a number of Stacks of §lextra space§r. You can use §lmultiple§r of the same §5§lStorage Upgrade§r on a single §lBarrel§r, as long as you have enough §lSlots§r.
    The basic §5§lStorage Upgrade§r takes §l1 Slot§r, and increases the §lStorage§r limit by §l64 stacks§r.
    The next §ltier§r up, §5§lStorage Upgrade x3§r, takes §l3 Slots§r, but increases §lStorage§r by §l192 stacks§r!
    Need even more §lspace§r? The §5§lStorage Upgrade x9§r takes §l9 Slots§r, but increases §lStorage§r by §l576 stacks§r!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Better Control
questDatabase.description:
There is plenty more you can do with a §lBarrel§r than just stuff it full of §lstones§r or§l bricks§r or whatever you fancy. You can§l customize§r them with §lupgrades§r that §lenable§r them to be used in §lautomation§r builds. 
    Normally you can only §lsee§r whats in a §lBarrel§r from the §lfront§r. You can turn any other side of the §lBarrel§r into the same §ldisplay§r by §l§nSneak + Right Clicking§r a §5§lSticker§r onto it!
    The §5§lRedstone Upgrade§r enables a §lBarrel§r to emit a§l Redstone Signal§r when it is §lfull§r. Apply a §5§lRedstone Sticker§r to any §lface§r you want the §lRedstone Signal§r to §lemit§r from.
    The §5§lHopper Upgrade§r will make the §lBarrel§r act like a §lHopper§r. You'll need to §lplace§r a §5§lHopper facade§r to the §lside§r of the §lBarrel§r you want the §lBarrel§r to §lpush§r items to. 
    By applying a §5§lVoid Upgrade§r, any more §litems§r that go over the §lStorage§r limit of the§l Barrel§r will be §ldestroyed§r. This is good for §lstrip mining§r quarries§r, as §lexcess§r Cobblestone§r will be §lremoved§r.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Helpful Devices
questDatabase.description:
Our further research into Draconium and dragons in general has come up with a bunch more helpful devices you might like!
    The Advanced Player Detector is an improved version of the Player Detector. 20 block range, lets you camoflauge it, and has an Inverted Redstone Signal mode to save you wiring space! It also has a white/blacklist so you can add your trusted assistants to it and not have them set up off some sort of protective failsafe!
    Then we have the Disenchanter. You can take a magical item and place it in the left slot, an empty book in the center slot, and hit the Transfer button and voila, the top listed enchant has been moved to the book! Careful, as this damages the magical item! You can cut down or outright prevent the damage by surrounding the Disenchanting table with bookshelves.
    Last but not least is the Draconic Chest. It bends space and time so has a giant inventory, as well as a crafting bench inside that. On top of that, it also has a furnace inside of it, which will double Ores smelted inside it. You can hold the chest and Shift + Right Click to change its color before setting it down.

questDatabase.name: Better Spacial Anomolies
questDatabase.description:
Given the research into these Endermen of yours, one of my assistants has helped come up with a way to link two Better Barrels to the same dimensional storage space. We've decided to call it... B-Space. For Barrel. Kind of like L-Space (if you've heard of it), except with less uh... dangers.
    To apply the BSpace Upgrade to a Barrel, it must be empty. To link two Barrels together, they must :
    1) Be Empty
    2) Have BSpace Upgrades
    3) Have the same Structural Upgrade
    You can then Sneak + Right Click the Tuning Fork onto each Barrel to link them together.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Better Better Better!
questDatabase.description:
Upgrading your Barrels doesn't stop with just 567 extra stacks of material. With these Structural and Storage upgrades, you condense quite a lot of something into a tiny, portable space!
    Structural Upgrades can go up to 31, 63, or 127 slots!
    Storage Upgrades can go up to 1,728 or 5,184 stacks!

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Defensive Strategy
questDatabase.description:
A good §lbase§r doesn't just rely on §loverwhelming firepower§r to keep its §lenemies§r out. A solid §lwall§r and foreboding §lfence§r can be enough to turn away smaller §lhooligans§r.
    Each §lTier§r of §5Hard Wall§r and §5§lFence§r is §lharder§r and §lmore resistant§r to the previous one. Any §5§lTier 2§r or higher §5§lFence§r, as well, is also §lcovered §rin §lbarbs§r, and will §ldamage§r all §lcreatures§r that §ltouch§r it.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Botania - Magical Flowers!
questDatabase.description:
Okay, the few flowers that Biologist Bitsy sent me were very interesting! I see there are about 16 different species scattered about... Could you send me, say, five of any of them? They should glow very slightly, hard to miss!
    There also seems to be a tall variety of them, but are a bit more fragile. Use Shears on those to collect them! They seem to like to grow in bunches. Be sure to gather as many as you can, we can figure out how to grow them ourselves later.

display:10.Name:8: Any Mystical Flower
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Crush a bit...
questDatabase.description:
These flowers are gorgeous! They've caught the eye of a few assistants... and of the CEO. He's requisitioned a lab and greenhouse for my newly formed team. We've been researching, and I just sent you a modified version of the "Book Model" of the QUEST Tablet called the Lexica Botania. It's connected to our systems here, and we can share research with each other this way! 
    Why Botania? Thats the name of this new corporate position! Botaniason Belle, thats me! The book will explain a lot more, so lets get started...
    Craft a couple flowers to get their Petals. Any color will do, really. You can Right Click a petal on the ground to bury it, and it will make the ground shimmer in that color a bit. If you use some Bone Meal on this, it will grow into a Double Flower! This is great for multiplying colors you already have. You'll need to use Shears on the Double Flower to harvest it properly though.
    Combining a Pestle and Mortar with a petal will grind it down into Floral Powder. A lot of these powders also double as Dyes! Mix two petals worth of powder and some ground bones together. You can use this in a grassy area like you would Bonemeal, and it will grow a handful of Mystical Flowers for you!

display:10.Name:8: Any Mystical Petal
Any Floral Powder
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Botaniason Tools 1
questDatabase.description:
Now that we can grow more Flowers (unreliably, but still!), we can more earnestly begin to research them. Just in our initial tests, the Flowers are amazing in of themselves, but we were quick to discover just how magical they were! One of the assistants was using a large Stone bowl full of warm water to see if he could infuse the water with Magic. He says he got lost just watching the Petals swirling around (I admit, it IS quite calming!). 
    He was so lost to it, he took out a snack of some roasted Seeds (Quite the OSHA violation I have to say...) and accidently dropped some into the bowl. Suddenly the Water, the Petals, and the Seeds vanished in a puff of magic, and the assistant found a strange, new Flower in his hand! He quickly planted it to observe it, and noticed it had a strange effect on the Logs and Stones around it...
    The Petal Apothecary is the best way to use this new magical ability. You can fill it by Right Clicking a Bucket of Water onto it, or dropping the item itself on top. You then toss the petals or other items (hold them in your hand and press Q to throw). When looking at the Apothecary, it will show you what components are swirling around, and if they make anything. Quite handy!
    An even handier thing : If you refill the Apothecary with Water and Right Click with an Empty Hand within 20 seconds, you'll readd the same ingredients you used to create the last Flower (if they are in your inventory that is!). Super useful for crafting a lot of Flowers in a row!
    Toss four Mystical White Petals into the Apothecary. Then toss a Seed into the Apothecary, and out will pop a new Flower! If you are having a tough time finding regular Seeds, you can transform almost any seed into one by combining it with some Floral Powder.
    Place the Pure Daisy on a bit of Dirt or Grass, and surrounded it with either Stone or Logs. After a bit, the Pure Daisy will transform them into something new! Could you send me some samples of both?
    The Living Wood and Stone seem to be infused with some sort of energy, so lets try making something with it... like some Livingwood Twigs! We can then attach some petals to them, and create a Wand... A Wand of the Forest! The color of the petals you craft the wand with will change the actual wand colors. The Wand has two modes : Function and Bind, and you can swap between them by Sneak + Right Clicking.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Botaniason Tools 2
questDatabase.description:
With some of the things we've discovered about Mana and utilizing it, I think we can easily improve on a few tools so far and start researching more things. I highly suggest making more of those Endoflame flowers, as I get the feeling we'll be using a LOT more Mana as we research more things...
    The Pulse Mana Spreader is a version of the Mana Spreader that will only send Mana when it has a Redstone Signal.
    The Thaumaturgic branch have been working alongside us, and we've worked out a way to imbue their Scribing Tools with Mana, so that they can refill it in a Mana Pool instead of with Ink Sacs, which we feel is much more Magical.
    Also, something we've found in our studies of this new Mana is an odd thing. Well, one of the Assistants is a bit infatuated with Halloween (which is forever away, you know!) and was making some spooky things with some of the materials we've been testing here... 
    Well, he took a Pumpkin that had been filled with some Bone, some Rotten Flesh, a bit of Gunpowder, and hung it from a String atop a pole made of Iron Bars, and suddenly the Mana burst it to life in the form of a floating, burning creature that spat fireballs at us!
    According to the other Branches here that have been studying your data, it's apparently called a Blaze? Well, the Mana that infused it seems to make it drop a lot of Blaze Powder, instead of the reported Blaze Rods... perhaps this will be useful to you?

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Energy Control
questDatabase.description:
Very interesting! Those Day Blooms and Nightshades really go to town! Our scanners show that 'energy' builds nicely during over the course of the day. You know, it really needs a better name... well, lets call it Mana since this is still technically an 'occult' wing of The Business.
    We should find a way to collect and harness this Mana, and I think making a large vessel of Living Stone and some tools from the Living Wood should work. We can also shape these materials and turn them into something to help us utilize this Mana.
    A Mana Pool should do nicely to collect the Mana in, but we'll need something to gather the Mana and transport it to this vessel, which is where a Mana Spreader should be helpful!
    When a Mana Spreader has enough Mana, it will fire it out where it is aiming. We call this a Mana Burst. You can select a Mana Spreader by holding your Wand of the Forest and Sneak + Right Clicking on it while in Bind mode. It will have a rainbow box around it. You can then target where it's aiming with Sneak + Right Clicking the target. Mana Pools cannot gather Mana themselves, you'll need to use a Spreader to transfer Mana from the flowers to one. 
    You can also Right Click any Wool onto the Mana Spreader to both decorate it and muffle the shooting sound. Oh, a fun thing we found out! If you Right Click any color of Floral Powder into the Mana Pool, it will dye it that color!
    The normal Mana Pool is quite useful, but I think we can make a slightly smaller one in capacity. It'd be quite helpful in determining how much Mana we're generating over time, for example, so a Diluted Mana Pool can be quite helpful. 
    Now that we have some Mana and a place to store it, we can see what happens when we dip various items into it. First thought to us was try a bit of Redstone, which is slightly Magical in its own way, and we ended up with this interesting, blue version we're calling Mana Powder! This Mana Powder gives us even more to work with in finding new flowers, like this Endoflame! It burns solid fuel like Coal dropped near it to generate a Mana much faster than the Dayblooms and Nightshades!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Sun and Moon Flowers
questDatabase.description:
So.... we've been testing the Petal Apothecary a bit more after that 'sunflower seed' incident / breakthrough. What kind of seeds can be the catalyst are a bit confusing, but we've found that the Floral Powder can be combined with almost any seed to transform it into a basic Seed.
    We've found two new flowers that seem to generate that "Energy" we mentioned before. Coincidently, the two seem to be opposites of each other as well! They only live for a few days after being planted, though, but I don't doubt we can find more hearty flowers than these two. It's a good start though!
    The Daybloom creates Mana during the day, as long as it can see the sky! The Nightshade generates Mana during the night, as long as it can see the star-filled sky!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Mana Infusion
questDatabase.description:
Interesting! If you hold your Living Wand, you can even see the energy flowing from the Mana Spreaders, and it seems to even control how things rotate. I have one of my assistants practicing with his wand, and I'm updating the Lexica Botania with more instructions as we speak. Since dipping Redstone Dust into Mana has netted us progress, we'll just start tossing everything but the kitchen sink into this Mana Pool! We'll be sure to add more things we discover to the Lexica Botania as we find them.
    Managlass can be turned into Panes, while Manasteel can be formed into Blocks for easier storage.
    Looking at all our research, we're going to be using more and more Mana in the tools we make. Plus, we don't quite look the magical part, no? I mean, we're working with Mana and stuff...
    So, enter the Manaweave Cloth. By combining Mana Infused String to create Cloth, you can then form the Cloth into various pieces of Manaweave Clothing. By wearing an entire set of Manaweave Clothing, all tools and devices you use that require Mana will take a good bit less! That means you can use them for much longer, and to boot you look quite fetching!
    Since it might take a good bit for you to gather enough Mana and String, I'll only ask you to make the Robe Top.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Manipulation of Mana
questDatabase.description:
It takes more time than we really care for to examine how each new flower we discover works, how much power its generating, etc. We've worked in a bit of older technology into our research, the Redstone Dust technology. With it, we've been able to create devices that let us detect, spread, and remove Mana from what we are calling a Mana Network. During this research, we've also discovered a new Flower that will detect if your Mana Network is either gaining or losing Mana. 
    When a Mana Burst travels through the Mana Detector, it will emit a Redstone signal. 
    The Mana Distributor only spreads the mana to pools that are touching it. Make sure not to accidently block the Mana Bursts with one of the pools!
    Any Mana Burst that hits the Mana Void is destroyed. Completely. Never existed!
    When the Manastar is Blue, it means the Mana Network it is on is gaining Mana. If it is Red, well, better find what's draining your Mana.
    When worn in your Amulet slot, the Manaseer Monocle allows you to see Mana Bursts, even if something else is in the way.
    Need to transport your Mana long distances? Well, put it on a Minecart with Mana Pool! You can combine a Mana Pool and Minecart, and then pump Mana ino it with a Mana Pump. Mana is pulled from the Blue side of the pump and put into the Pink side of the pump. You cannot fill or empty Mana from a Mana Minecart any other way.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Signal to Noise
questDatabase.description:
We've been combining various Petals and items in different ways to see what we come up with. At first, we created a pretty yet useless, and slightly Unstable, Cube.
