display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Power of the Stars
questDatabase.description:
I have Invented what I feel is one of the most powerful Generators to date! After you've shown me that Unstable Block, I got some ideas while I was working on improving the Generators even more. By using the immense potential energy of a Nether Star, with the logic bending properties of Unstable material, I've come up with this super Generator! I'm not sure any energy pipes I know of can transfer this much energy at once...
    Be careful! Once the Nether Star Generator starts to Generate power, it will damage any living or unliving creature within 10 blocks of it!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Tiny Generator, Amazing Power!
questDatabase.description: Time marches on, and Inventology leads the way! We can take the bigger Generators, and improve them by yet another factor of Eight, to create these crazy, amazingly powerful Generators!

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Interesting Tools
questDatabase.description:
Examining the Magical nature of all your world's materials has lead to some interesting inventions on my part. Even your most basic of materials seems to have some very interesting properties! I'm pretty sure we can discover even more things to Invent at this rate. Maybe I can get a bigger office... I mean lab. Anyways!
    I got new curtains yesterday for my house. Complete garbage. They were "blackout" curtains but didn't block the light enough! So I made some with the Wool you sent me and... well, I got what I wanted. The curtains block ALL light from passing through it, as well as let you easily walk through them without letting light past.
    Laboratory testing tends to generate a lot of trash. Failed experiments, broken equipment... well, I made a Trash Can out of some of your materials for the lab next door, and it worked well. REALLY well! Anything put into the trash can just... vanishes!
    I love how Obsidian looks, and I wanted to see if I could find more use out of it other than as a Blast resistant material. Well, I call this an Angel Block, as I feel it can save your life. By merely placing it in front of you, even in empty air, it will stay there. You can do this under your feet if you start to fall, and it will stop you! Then just punch it once, and it pops right back into your pocket!
    Things can get quite noisy here in The Business. Labs testing various devices, creating giant thunderstorms, causing accidental explosions... sometimes its hard to nap at your desk! Your Wool has amazing properties, and makes quite powerful noise mufflers! There's two of them, a Rain Muffler and a Sound Muffler.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Better Glass
questDatabase.description:
Glass itself is quite useful, yeah? Helps keep bugs out, lets us see out of our houses, and treated just right it can be be shatter resistant and as tough as metal. But, sometimes, we need it to be even tougher! And we can use the Magical properties of your materials to do this. I call it Thickened Glass. You can make a nice range of different varieties of the Thickened Glass as well, depending on what you combine it with. Some of the other labs have even started taking notice of what we are doing here!
    Just mix some regular Glass with some Sand to get the initial material. Sandy Glass looks kind of interesting on its own, don't you think?
    Now cook it up, like you would normal Glass. This is Thickened Glass, and it looks sleeker and better! It's ALSO a bit more blast resistant than normal glass!
    I love how normal Thickened Glass looks, but we can do a whole lot more with the looks, like make Glass Bricks or Swirling Glass. Could you send me samples of each? I want to decorate the place, more labs are taking notice of what we are doing... I can think of a lot of designs you can make.
    When we start mixing other things into the Thickened Glass, we get quite interesting results! Some of it looks pretty, other pieces seem to emit light themselves! Again, send me some samples!
    While normal Thickened Glass is more Blast Resistant, I wanted something even MORE resistant. To that, just add Obsidian to make Obsidian Glass!
    I had a crazy idea after making Obsidian Glass. What if we add in... Blackout Curtains? I did, and well... you can see through the glass perfectly. Only light doesn't pass through it. Which should be impossible, right?

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Magical Technology
questDatabase.description:
I've started to work more and more with all the Magical materials you have supplied me with. I wasn't getting anywhere myself, so I took a little stroll through a few of the nearby labs, as a good Inventologist tends to do to get more ideas. Well, I came across one of the newer labs, and they were inlaying Metal on circuit boards and using Quartz in various ways... The researchers were explaining to me how Quartz keeps good timing, and how it also helps in transmitting light and data and... I missed some stuff, he was talking really fast as he was pushing me to the door, also saying something about "...thats why we need controlled environments too!". Well, I got many more ideas from him and that lab that I just HAD to start work on something myself! And after a lot of hard work, some stol... borrowed... research materials and blueprints, I've definitely got something for you! One part Magic, one part Technology, all parts Inventology!
    I started by combining the sleekness of Obisidian with the mysteriousness of Ender Pearls, and created quite an alluring looking material with Ender-infused Obsidian.
    I was able to find a way to imbue a Shelf of Books with the Magical properties of Enchanted Books. This morphed it into a powerful block of Magical Wood material. You can easily make some cheap Enchanted Books on a lone Enchantment Table. As a bonus, if you put this block a few meters away from one, it'll boost its power a bit!
    Seeing how they inlaid Metal on silicon boards got me thinking... could we not do the same with our new materials? Instead of Quartz, we use Diamonds and the Ender-Infused Obsidian to create a Computational Matrix!
    With this new Ender infused Computational Matrix, I think we can tap into the vast, mysterious dimension of the Endermen, and all the power that may contain within. This QED I've Invented is basically a powerful, otherworldy Crafting Bench, able to make special items infused with pure Ender energy.
    While we can tap into the Ender's world, we can't tap into their Power with the same device. To do that we'll need to make something similar to a Generator, but will instead convert RF Energy into End Energy. Neither these Crystals nor the QED can store End Energy, so when creating something in the QED it will transfer the power at that time.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Transfer Materials
questDatabase.description:
I've become enamored with one of the item piping systems one of the other research departments has been working on. An item of any size can be put into one of their tubes and it'll travel through it like water, and come out somewhere else. I liked it, but thought... we can do better than that. Thats what Inventology is all about! 
    So, to start with, we need a way to put items 'into' a piping system. Thus, the Transfer Node. You put it on a chest or other piece of inventory, and it'll start collecting the top item in the box into it. Meanwhile, it will search through our network of pipes for somewhere else to put it. Since it'd be silly to fill a box with both water and machinery, I've made two different Nodes : Items and Liquids. Both can transfer along the same pipes though. Along with these, I have a big assortment of Pipes you can use, each useful in many different ways!
    For items to move around, you need to use Transfer Pipes. When node finds a junction with multiple paths, it will choose one randomly: if you want the item to keep going straight, use the Crossover Pipe at junctions.
    Attach Transfer Node (Items) to an inventory you wish to pull items from. It will grab the first item into its buffer, and search the pipe network its connected to, randomly choosing a direction when it hits a fork in the road, until it finds an inventory to drop the item in, or a dead end, then starts again. The Transfer Node (Liquids) can draw from Tanks or other liquid holding devices.
    Sometimes, you only want to put a certain amount of an item in an inventory, like if you were trying to evenly distribute Coal into some Generators. The Rationing Pipe will only put up to a full stack of material in an inventory, while a Hyper-Rationing Pipe will only put a single of an item into it.
    Each direction the Filter Pipe can go is a different color. You can set each color to filter out a different item, and ONLY that item will travel that direction. You can make an Item Filter and use it instead to filter out more than one item in a given direction.
    Already have a storage system set up? Sorting Pipes can help augment it. They will only place items into an inventory that already contains the item. The Mod Sorting Pipe will only put items into the inventory that match the Mod of any item in said inventory.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Powerful Transfers
questDatabase.description:
Transfer Nodes are great and all, but I began to wonder... can we do even more than this? Pipes are pretty simple in concept, so can't really have them do more than we already do... but I think with the power of the QDS we can reverse the power of a Transfer Node and have it RETRIEVE items from the Pipe Network! We can also transfer items and liquids around all day, but one thing we're missing? Energy transfer. Our compact piping system is missing a way of transfering energy along pipes as well! 
    Transfer Nodes work by sending the item through the network. Retrieval Nodes are the opposite : they will scan the network until it finds an inventory with a valid item, and will then grab it. Item Filters and most other Upgrades work on Retrieval Nodes as well.
    Energy Transfer Nodes accept Redstone Flux (RF), as well as Minecraft Joules (MJ). Energy Transfer Nodes can accept some upgrades like Transfer and Retrieval Nodes can.
    Energy Transfer Nodes only transfer along Energy Pipes. Item and Liquid pipes will ignore these pipes. The Energy Extraction Pipe acts like an Energy Transfer Node, giving you the ability to use only a single Energy Transfer Node for an entire network. Any generator connected to this pipe can send Energy through the network.
    We can pipe Power through our Pipe Networks now, and thats fantastic! But sometimes... sometimes you need power in an out of the way place, and running THAT much Pipe is just not feasible, nor is setting up a brand new power generator setup for it. The QDS lets us create items imbued with the power of the Ender, and these upgrades take that to full advantage. You'll need an Ender Transmitter and an Ender Receiver, and to etch the same name into both on an Anvil. This name becomes their Frequency, and all Transmitter and Receivers with the same name are on the same Frequency. This way, you can transfer power wirelessly! Note, there IS a bit of energy loss... but stacking multiple Transmitters on a node will increase the power output to that Frequency.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Upgrading Your Transfers
questDatabase.description:
Our Transfer Nodes are great and all, but they can be kinda... slow, you know? They only move one block a second when searching a network, which SEEMS fast until you have a pipe network that spans an entire aircraft hangar worth of space... To that end, I've devised several ways to upgrade your Transfer network. Whether its by increasing its speed, how many items it moves at once, or how it searches the system, I'm pretty sure you can find lots of useful things to do with these Upgrades!
    When searching, a node will move to the next pipe every second. Each one of these Speed Upgrades will increase the pipes it moves each second by 1, maxxing out at 64 per second.
    A Node only pulls a few of an item into its buffer with each operation. When you speed it up, it may only grab one or two off a stack before depositing its item and starting all over again. The Stack Upgrade will enable a Node to instead grab the entire stack of an item on the first operation.
    When a Node with the Depth-First Search Upgrade hits a fork in the road, it will remember which paths it has already taken. When it hits a dead end, it will go back to the last junction and go down and unsearched path. When the entire Network is seached, only then will it restart from the beginning.
    When searching with a Breadth-First Search Upgrade, the Node will always start with the closest inventories first then work outward.
    When searching with A Psuedo Round Robin Upgrade, the Node will always start with the closest inventories first then work outward.
    Nodes, so far, are only useful if they are connected to some sort of inventory : whether a chest or a liquid tank. With this little upgrade, though, we can attach the nodes to something else and have them interact with the world itself! You can generate Cobblestone by attaching an Item Node to a Cobblestone, and placing a Water Source Block on one side and a Lava Source Block on the other. 
    You can create an automated crafting system by pointing an Item Node at a basic Crafting Table, then putting a 3x3 grid of chests or barrels on the other side of the Crafting Table. Place items corresponding to a recipe, and it'll automatically craft the items for you. If you don't point the Item Node at anything, it will instead suck in dropped items slowly and pull them into an inventory, like a vaccuum. 
    Conversely, with a Liquid Node, you can point it at a Water Source Block that has two other water source blocks next to it, and the Node will generate water steadily for you.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Bigger Tools
questDatabase.description:
So thanks to the QDS I've started to come up with even more powerful tools and devices for you to use. They should definitely be more helpful for you given both the dangerous nature of your world and the volume of materials we'll be wanting from you in time. 
    Not only does the fancy looking Chandelier emit light farther than normal light sources, it also prevents mobs from spawning in a 16 block radius.
    Like the Chandelier, this Magnum Torch also emits brighter light, but it also prevents most mobs from spawning 64 blocks around it!
    Lava is a fairly useful thing for you. It can be used to generate power, defend yourself, and make Obsidian, but its dangerous to Pump. This Ender-Thermic Pump can help, though. Place it right over the Lava and supplying it with Power, it will Pump out Lava and replace it with Cobblestone to create a growing safe area to stand!
    The Ender Core is an upgraded version of Magical Wood. Placing it near an Enchanting Table will boost its power much higher than just Magical Wood or a plain Bookshelf will!
    The Ender Quarry is a very efficient mining machine. Supply it with power, place a chest next to it, and it will start to mine the area in front of it. It won't mine common material like stone or dirt, but it will mine anything like Ore, Gems, etc, and replace that material with Dirt, to prevent cave ins and stuff.
    To determine the area an Ender Quarry mines, you can surround the area with normal Wooden Fences, or you can use Ender-Markers at each corner of a rectangle. You MUST define an area either way, then place the Ender Quarry down next to one corner.
    Golden Spikes will damage and kill creatures that walk on them, much like the Iron Spikes. They will also, however, drop Experience Orbs as well.
    Diamond Spikes are the most powerful of them! Not only will they kill the creature, they will give it a chance of dropping items that usually only drop when you slay the creature with your own hands.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Research and Invent
questDatabase.description:
We do a lot of research here in The Ferret Business, and we've had to come up with a lot of our own tools to make research easier and faster. We also tend to work with new ideas and materials and things all the time, so... necessity is the mother of invention, they say. Since it seems you have an abundance of Redstone stuff in your world, some of these should definitely help you out since its a cornerstone of our technology here, and I've also come up with one or two Inventions that should help you out quite a lot! 
    The Conveyor Belt will move creatures, items, and even you and your assistants along its surface.
    This Filing Cabinet can store up to 270 of the same item, even if they have minor differences (like if one was more damaged, or named). It'll list them alphabetically for you as well!
    I notice you have a lot of Villages in your world, with inhabitants that like to barter and trade. With the Trading Post, the larger villages will be easier to track all the Trades with, as it will compile a list of all Trades around it, and give you an easy one stop shop for your Bartering needs.
    Sometimes you have a setup with Redstone and machines that needs to pulsed with a Redstone Signal regularly. This Redstone Clock can do just that without requiring a bunch of floor space for a larger contraption.
    The Block Update Detector can send a Redstone Pulse out if it detects a block next to it changing. The Advanced version can also detect minute changes in something like a Machine next to it.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Magical Inventions
questDatabase.description:
Examing your materials more and more I think we can definitely exploit the Magical nature of every material you have! I've created a few little interesting things for you, things that should definitely help you since you are mostly alone out there.
    Gold especially seems to be Magical in nature all on its own. By making a Golden Lasso out of it, I've created a way to temporarily miniaturize any single creature. Just use the Golden Lasso on them and pocket it, then use the Golden Lasso again later to release the creature!
    Weaving the Gold into cloth and studding it with Gemstones and making it into a Pouch seems to have a similar effect, except with Items. You can open this Golden Bag of Holding, put stuff into it, and it will store even more than you could normally carry, regardless of weight! You can also Dye the bag!
    Using the eye of an Enderman, I've constructed a little scanner you can use on various things around you to check their state. You might have to Sneak when using it on some things, but it might give you some useful data!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Magical Division?
questDatabase.description: Well, thats odd. For the past day or so, your Tablet scanner has been, well... crashing oddly, when it scans various parts of the world. We sent a firmware update to fix the 'error dividing' issue we were getting, and all looks good. Now, though, the data shows an odd... item... it blocks scanning further, part of the firmware update to prevent it crashing. All we know is it has something to do with dividing, and is hidden somewhere in chests scattered within your world.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Mathemagical
questDatabase.description:
This Division Sigil is... amazing. It appears it can bend reality just a bit, and only in your world, to do some amazing things... but only if you Activate it first. Take the Sigil to an Enchanting Table, and it will reveal how to do an Activation Ritual with the Division Sigil. From there, I bet we can do a whooole lot of inventing. Math is the cornerstone of science, and with this, just how much fun can we have? Yeah, I thought so!
    You'll want to make sure that the air above the ritual is completely clear, even of stationary clouds (the kind you can collect). Might want to invest in a jetpack!
    Use the Activated Division Sigil to divide a Gold Nugget by Diamond to make a Semi-Stable Nugget. You COULD make an entire Ingot by dividing an Iron Ingot instead, but... uh... that division is VERY unstable and WILL EXPLODE in 10 seconds. Its safer to use a Gold Nugget... Unstable Matter seems to be a troublesome material to handle. This is what happens when you Divide things by Diamond instead of something logical(or even Imaginary...)
    Oh, and it seems Unstable Ingots do not stack, but Unstable Blocks do.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Replicating Your Core
questDatabase.description:
The core of your world seems to be made of Bedrock. In our world, Bedrock is tough, but nowhere as tough as your world's version of Bedrock. With some Compressed Cobble and some Unstable material, I think we can make a fairly close recreation of your Bedrock. We'll call it Bedrockium. 
    Careful, Bedrockium Ingots weighs a whole lot! I'm amazed my backpack didn't instantly gain a new hole in it... and the ground underneath me... Especially when holding the Bedrockium Block!

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Dark Portal
questDatabase.description:
I've been tinkering more with combining Unstable material with Compressed Cobblestone, and well... I created something intriguing. The higher ups finally let me have a few assistants due to our Inventology research, and one was examining this new creation when he... well, he just vanished. He reappeared a few minutes later, looking scared but excited! He said he had appeared inside a stone box, torches already lit. He could hear... something, in the stone. He had his own QUEST Tablet on hand and ran some scans. 
    They told him he was at what is, literally, an impossible depth for our world, and that there were massive amounts of metals and other resources around, but also an innumerable amount of dangerous creatures and hazards. It's going to take me a bit to get through the paperwork to allow me to send exploration and security teams into this Deep Dark place... but... I'm giving you the instructions on how to make this portal. If you want to take the risk, I can't stop you. Be careful and safe journeys!
    The Darkness in this new place has a life of its own. Normal Light rules concerning monster spawning do not apply. Magnum Torches and Chandeliers DO work properly though. Any other light source will not stop monsters from spawning wherever they please.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Drum Solo
questDatabase.description: The Iron Drums we made are fantastic and hold so much liquid in such a compact space.... but... sometimes we need to hold MORE liquid in the same amount of space. I've made other things with Bedrockium in place of Iron so... I tried it with a Drum. And boy did it exceed my expectations! These Bedrockium Drums hold 256 times more than a regular drum!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Ethereal Accessories
questDatabase.description:
I've been given permission to build a second wing to the Inventology area of The Business, as experimenting with Unstable matter has proven... damaging. The only cavaet is the building has to be constructed by myself and the couple of assistants I've finally been granted. Not really a problem, there are a lot of various building tools at our disposal from the various research labs and tech testing wings... but I had the feeling we could construct our own building tools, you know? Heck, I think we can take on all aspects of building, from gathering materials to building really high!
    Wearing these Sonar Goggles lets you see deep into very walls around you. It will create a wireframe around the material you look directly at, up to 5 blocks away, letting you see any hidden pockets of Ore or other materials.
    By holding the Builder's Wand and using it on placed material in the world, such as a wall of Wood, you can extend it out automatically! You have to have the same material in your inventory, though, you cannot just make something out of nothing.
    When building, or heck, even when moving around, a lot of times its useful to have a ladder. Or wings! The latter being vastly more useful and just more fun! And now, with Unstable material, you can, by employing the use of the Angel's Ring!

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Ethereal Tools
questDatabase.description:
This Unstable material is very power and very versatile. I've used it, combined with some obsidian to make it safe to hold, to make some of the standard tools we use around The Business. Each one seems to have quite a unique property related to the type of tool it is. They all, though, seem to not wear down at all.
    The Destruction Pickaxe cuts through stone like butter and does not wear down, but nor does it drop any blocks.
    When you hit a creature with the Healing Axe, it will take health from you and give it to the creature. Unless it is undead, then it will deal quad damage to it.
    Like the Destruction Pickaxe, the Erosion Shovel will carve through anything soft as dirt, and will destroy any sand or gravel up above the block you destroy so you don't get buried, but it will also not drop any of these materials.
    The Reversing Hoe reverses time on some blocks. It will rewind time on crops you use it on, which isn't helpful, but it will also turn dirt into grass and Cobblestone into Stone.
    The Precision Shears work like normal Shears, but can also carve through any material thats as strong as Stone. Sneak + Right Click the Shears on the material to slice it cleanly.

display:10.Name:8: §fPaper Pickaxe
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Golden Improvements
questDatabase.description:
Magical Wood is, well, quite Magical. Just how Magical we already know from its use in the QDS, but it can also be used to upgrade a couple other things you have. 
    You seem to be able to come back from the dead easily in your world, but your equipment and backpack do not. By infusing a Bag of Holding with Magical Wood, you can respawn with the Bag itself at least! You'll have to empty the bag, though, for the QUEST Tablet to scan it properly.
    The Filing Cabinet (Advanced) will only hold items that do not normally stack nicely, like Swords or other tools. It will also organize them alphabetically for you for easy retrieval!

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Ethereal Weapon
questDatabase.description:
Tools made of Unstable material have amazing, helpful properties, I have to say. We've made a sword the same way, and... we weren't sure of its properties yet until an assistant was trying to combine it with other items and accidently cut himself. Only he didn't. He gave a cry of pain and dropped the Etheric Sword, along with a whispy ball of... sorta like smoke, but he wasn't bleeding or anything. After making sure he was okay, we checked the sword and this new item carefully. 
    It kind of reminded us of him, actually. We couldn't make heads or tails of it, so visited other research departments. The Thaumaturgic Crafting wing shed some light on us, as it was much like their magical aspects... except ours apparently was a piece of a Soul directly. They said he might be a little bit weaker as a result and to be careful. To be fair, we all agreed to do the same thing once, so now we have a small pile of Soul Fragments to research with. 
    You gain a Soul Fragment each time you craft just the Etheric Sword in your crafting grid. The cost, though, is a heart from your lifebar. Permanently. You cannot go below three hearts, though, so don't worry.
    So far we've only found one thing we can make with it. The normal Watering Can is super helpful, but strangely fragile. We cannot hook it up to a machine to automatically water things without it just imploding. By adding a Soul Fragment, though, we can make a Watering Can (Reinforced) that can survive the rough handling of automated machines.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The Glass Curtain
questDatabase.description:
These Unstable Ingots you can create with an Activated Division Sigil are amazing! I've tried it in various applications and come up with some really neat things. Take this glass : I infused it with an Unstable Ingot and got a nice, fancy glass that you can walk through, but monsters and animals cannot! Ethereal Glass can be passed through by you and you assistants, but no creature can pass through it. You can make it even clearer, which I call Ineffable Glass.
    I've also created a version similar to the Dark Glass at the request of some of the Occult wings of The Business, simply called... Dark Ethereal Glass, obviously! No light can pass through this version of Ethereal Glass.
    Conversely, I've also come up with something that will stay the same brightness at all times, perfect for movie studios needing a Green Screen! No matter the light level or angle viewed, Lapis Caelestis blocks always show the same exact bright color.

display:10.Name:8: Any Lapis Caelestis
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Bigger, Better, Faster
questDatabase.description:
So lately I've been tinkering with ways of making your Ender Quarry even better. Since it uses some of the Magic of the Endermen, we can't really use the same conventional means as other Quarries or machines to upgrade them. I have, however, Invented a way to augment the Ender Quarry! These devices need to be placed so that they touch the Ender Quarry itself to enhance it. Each one does something different, and some cause a bigger power draw than others.
    You'll need the Ender Quarry Upgrade Base as the core of every Upgrade.
    Normally, the Ender Quarry only grabs things that are not Dirt or Stone and replaces them with Dirt. The Ender Quarry World Hole Upgrade will have the Ender Quarry grab everything without replacing it.
    The Ender Quarry Silk Touch Upgrade will have the Quarry pick up blocks whole, instead of breaking them. You'll get Redstone Ore instead of it breaking down into Redstone Dust, for example.
    Each of these Ender Quarry Fortune Upgrades improves the chance of extra drops when the Quarry mines something that breaks into other components (For example, you may get 5 or more Redstone Dust per Ore instead of the normal 4).
    The Ender Quarry Speed Upgrades will enhance the speed the Quarry works.
    The Ender Quarry Pump Upgrade adds the Ender Pump to the Quarry, enabling it to grab Liquid as well as long as it has a valid pipe or tank to pump it through.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Soft Spoken Teacher
questDatabase.description: Pleasant talking to you, Bandit. I'm not sure of your rank in The Business, but right now, I'd like to consider myself your teacher, and you my student. I work off a mixture of both show and tell, that is to say, I'll explain something to you, and then you either send me or show me your work. As you show me your growing skills in what I have to show you, the more I will teach you and the more I will reward you.

questDatabase.name: Basic Components
questDatabase.description:
To start with, I will show you how to make the simplest of components. You may know about some of these, but I'd like to explain them anyways so we're both on the same page. Assuming things leads to accidents, and I'd rather avoid the paperwork for such things, wouldn't you? 
    Relax, that was a joke, but getting hurt isn't, so we'll go steady and make sure you have things down each step of the way, especially as the word is your entire world is infused with... magic? Well, we are not sure how it might effect things, my assistants are hopeful that it'll improve things in the long run. I'd like you to send me two samples of each component you make, so that we can make sure you have the idea down, and also to examine and research them ourselves.
    To make a Basic Gear, shape four sections of stone into servicable gear teeth, and use sturdy wooden sticks to hold them together. Just one stick wouldn't work, but the four sticks can hold together and do more than just the sum of their parts.
    A Capacitor stores energy and dissipates it at a constant rate. To make the most Basic Capacitor, we'll use some very conductive metal, mainly Gold Nuggets, to create the two 'plates' that store the electrical charge between them. We'll use the Copper to create some small wire leads and coat both ends in Redstone so that the conductor stores Redstone Flux, or RF, energy for us. Why? Because a lot of RF engines don't have a... steady... output, and our machines need to be able to store a bit of RF like a battery in case the RF generators stop for any reason.
    Most of the machines I will show you how to make all require a secure, sturdy housing we call a Machine Chassis. This provides a solid base for them, and gives them anchor points for any moving parts they may have. A frame made of solid Iron rods, with a thinner mesh of Iron Bars should work well.
    Rubber is the standard material used in insulation, but isn't used as much when we also need to bind parts together. Most glue I know of isn't suited for the job: it either conducts electricity, which defeats the purpose, or melts when heated up. Thus, I use a material called Conduit Binder, which does as it says : binds things. By mixing some Clay with some Sand and Gravel in specific amounts, you get a Composite material you can then melt in a Furnace to get the Conduit Binder.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The First Tier
questDatabase.description:
So now that you have shown me that you can make the basic components, lets advance to the first real stage of our lessons. I'll teach you how to make a power generator that will let you power the four other machines. With these machines, you'll be able to do a variety of things, including making somewhat more advanced materials. 
    I'll warn you, things will start to get more complex as we get deeper into these lessons, but with the quality of the work you sent me? I have very little to worry about, you show a ton of promise, Bandit!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The Long Grind
questDatabase.description:
To process various basic materials, we need to break them down a bit. This machine design is called a SAG Mill. You can grind many different things in it, but perhaps the most useful to you will be Ore. If you grind a chunk of, lets say, Iron Ore, the SAG Mill will sift out enough Iron Dust to melt down into two Iron Ingots, instead of only one, as when you melt an entire chuck of Iron Ore, you lose material burning away the impure Cobblestone. 
    But, given how geological strata tends to be, the machine also has a chance of sifting out other useful materials. In the case of Iron Ore, it might find enough Tin Dust for you, or even enough Iron Dust for another Ingot. It may also have enough ground down stone for a useable chuck of Cobblestone. 
    You can upgrade the machine with a few different items. Bigger capacitors will give it a bigger internal Battery. There is also a spot for a Grinding Ball to increase efficiency. Flint is a good starting material to use as a Grinding Ball.
    There are two things, for sure, you will need for bigger machines, so I would like you to send us a few samples of them.
    With the first item, I highly suggest wearing some gloves, and clothes you do not mind getting really dirty. Many of the alloys we use require a boost in temperature for a very short time, and to achieve that we use Pulverized Coal. It is simple to obtain, just put some Coal in a SAG Mill.
    The second item, Silicon, is one supremely useful element. Most biological forms require it, even a tiny amount of it. We can easily obtain some by grinding Sand in the SAG Mill to sift it to a useable form.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Simple Power Generation
questDatabase.description:
Most of the machines I will teach you how to make will require power to run. I'm not sure what kind of power generators you may or may not know yet, but I have a few designs that I know work well. The simplest of these is a Stirling Generator. 
    It will burn solid fuels, and use the heat and pressure to move cylinders inside the machine back and forth to generate energy. The Capacitor inside will act as a battery to store some of the RF energy it creates.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Metal Mixing
questDatabase.description:
Iron, Copper, Tin, all of these are useful in various ways on their own. Iron is strong, Tin is easily shaped, Copper is a great conductor. But for more useful, powerful machines, we'll need better materials that still retain the different qualities these metals have. One of the best ways to do that is to mix the metals, or the metal with other materials, to create an Alloy using the Alloy Smelter. This new material will have various properties from all its base materials, and can even form stronger properties from various chemical or other interactions, or in your world's case, a little bit of Magic perhaps! 
    Some things we will be making will require a metal that is both fairly conductive for RF Energy, but also strong. We can create Conductive Alloy by smelting together Iron and Redstone Dust. This creates a fairly strong metal that can transfer Energy fairly efficiently.
    Many of the machines we will be making require something a little bit stronger than Iron. Usually this means we need to refine Iron into Steel, both requiring Coal Powder for higher temps. Now, there are two main methods I use to refine Iron, and each one produces a different type of Steel. The first is using Silicon to help refine the Iron into Electrical Steel.
    The second, much more recent discovery thanks to researchers here at The Business, is replacing the Silicon with Obsidian instead, which creates a much stronger steel called Dark Steel.
    Other machines require special alloys for transmitting Energy in different ways. By heating up Redstone, we can then mix it with Silicon to get Redstone Alloy, highly conductive to RF transfer. 
    Two of my assistants have been collecting a bit of research data and presented it to me, and I'm confident we can make an even more Energy based alloy. In what you call "The Nether" are glowing materials, similar in structure to Stone, but Glow quite brightly. If you take some Glowstone Dust and mix it with some molten Gold and some Redstone in the Alloy Smelter, the resulting Energetic Alloy should be full of potential energy.
    Lastly, we've found that we can melt Soul Sand down and mix it with molten Gold to form a new Alloy.
    Please send us samples of this list of Alloys I want you to make, I want to test them with these Magical components.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Better Transparency
questDatabase.description:
Many times, just regular glass will not cut it when we need it in a machine. It either melts easily when we don't want it to, or it just isn't clear enough to suit our needs. With the Alloy Smelter, we can solve both of these issues quite easily. Clearer glass is easier to accomplish, but the stronger glass will require a bit of a jaunt to the Nether, I'm afraid to say. 
    When melted down, Quartz creates a structurally sound Glass that is good for higher temperature situations, or when working with UV Light, Telescopes, and many other things. The problem is it doesn't look like your 'base' world has enough Quartz in your sand to use... but your Nether has it in abundance.
    A common method of making glass is melting down sand. The problem with this? There can be a wide variety of impurities in the sand, which show up in the Glass itself and make it imperfect. Little whorls, light shining through oddly, little scuffs deep in the glass. We can fix this quite simply by heating the sand in the Alloy Smelter, which can heat evenly for a much longer time than a normal Furnace, burning away impurities in the molten Glass and giving us something that is Quite Clear Glass as a result.
    Please pass us some samples of these materials as well, as some of my assistants believe they are on the track of something new.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Simply Handy
questDatabase.description:
The QUEST Tablet scanner shows you have a wide variety of materials you can use to build items and structures with, Bandit. But as its mostly just you working on things, you have to make everything by hand yourself, not to mention collect all the materials as well! This leaves you with perhaps a lack of both the nicer looking materials and the time to make everything by hand. 
    It also leaves you a bit... shorthanded, when it comes to making things a bit more intricate like computer chips and logic processors... and given the 'apparent' magicalness of your world, I think we can exploit it. These three machines should help you out a whole lot. 
    The Painting Machine lets you 'paint' the design of one block onto a cheaper piece of material. You can paint any of the following : Conduit Facades, Fences, Fence Gates, Stairs, Glowstone, and Slabs.
    The Slice n' Splice should enable you to hook some of the simpler electronic components to a Zombie Head, using it as a sort of organic processor. Along with the components to make any of these uh... 'logic' processors... you'll need to supply some cutting implements. A pair of Shears and an Iron Axe should suffice.
    The first 'logic' processor you can make is the Z-Logic Controller. With this, you can make the Crafter, which will help you automatically create items, taking out the monotonous process of crafting a single item over and over again. You can configure it to pull items, or push finished products, into a chest connected to it.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The Second Tier
questDatabase.description:
I feel you've shown your growing expertise quite well. All the various materials you've provided us with for examination have proved excellent, as well as quite useful in examining your world. 
    The inclusion of Glowstone in some materials has us looking into other materials unique to your world, including those intriguing Endermen and the, strange for me to be saying seriously, walking undead Zombies and Skeletons.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Home Distillery
questDatabase.description:
The Stirling Generator is a fantastic little power generator, but thats exactly what it is... little. It's also fairly inefficient, given the scope of things I am going to be showing you. But before we can get to those bigger, better things, we need to discuss Fuel. Solid combustables like coal are good in a sense, but we need something more concentrated, with much different properties. 
    Specifically, we need liquid fuels now. To that end, we first need to make a Reservoir.
    The Reservoir is good for holding and generating Water. You need to make a 2x2x1 structure of Reservoires for the tank to form. As long as two buckets worth of water are in it, it will generate another bucket every second.
    Now you can make the Vat, which with some water and some various ingredients to distill and ferment, we can make a small variety of Liquid Fuels. 
    Distilling sugar and wheat or apples or seeds, will get you some Hootch, a very basic fuel which you can also use instead of water to distill and concentrate more things : Redstone and Gunpowder would get you the equivilant of Rocket Fuel, while Redstone and the fiery Blaze Powder would get you Fire Water. 
    One other thing you can distill and ferment is Nutrient Distillation, which is made with water and a variety of once-living materials or mushrooms. Please send us one bucket worth of each so we can do more research with them.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Fitting Fixtures
questDatabase.description:
Primarily if we aren't dealing with the logistics of sorting items, we're dealing with Powering, Lighting, and whatnot various rooms. Power is something we'll cover some other time, but right now I can show you a few things that are generally quite helpful. 
    The first is a Fluid tank, which when constructed using your somewhat magical materials, becomes able to hold liquid of any temperature, though not a whole lot. 
    There are also a pair of lights you can make, each one useful depending on how big an area you need to light. The Light only requires a Redstone Signal to turn on, while the Powered Light will illuminate a larger area when supplied both RF Energy and a Redstone Signal.
    Both lights can be inverted by combining them with a Redstone Torch, changing it so that a Redstone Signal is only required to turn them off.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Daylight Power
questDatabase.description:
When we speak about efficiency in Generator design, we cannot forget that we have one of the biggest Generators at our disposal : The Sun. Due to its distance, we can't exactly tap into the vast amounts of power the Sun generates every second, but we CAN harness it a bit. 
    By coating Silicon with Energetic Alloy, hooking it up to a Daylight Sensor and creating a frame of Fused Quartz and Electrical Steel, we can create a Photovoltaic Cell. While one on its own doesn't generate much RF Power, you can place a lot of them for relatively cheaper materials. 
    Best of all, they require no fuels on your part, but only work in the daytime, and when in clear view of the sky.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Burning Water
questDatabase.description:
Now that we are able to distill Liquid Fuels for use, we need a new Generator to burn the fuel in. The Stirling Generator isn't quite able to burn liquid without melting itself, seeing as it doesn't have any way to hold either the Liquid Fuel or the Coolant required. 
    By combining a stronger Electrical Steel and a few Reservoirs, we can create a Combustion Generator, which has an internal chamber to burn the Fuel and keep it from getting too hot with some Water. 
    Another way we can generate power, though, is by employing some of your world's Magic... by hooking up a Zombie Head to a similar construct as the Combustion Generator, by keeping the head alive with Nutrient Distillation, it will continue to generate power for you. Yes, the Zombie Generator seems a bit macabre but... better then getting your brain consumed like, say, a Cornetto.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Few New Tools
questDatabase.description:
Since we are beginning to work with much more advanced machinery, we will require better tools. Some of these tools use some of the more... magical properties we've started to research thanks to you. 
    The Yeta Wrench is similar to many other wrenches, and can work in place of those for other research department's machines when needed, but the Electrical Steel ours is made of gives it a special function with various bits of machinery and miscellanious items I'll be showing you later. A major function for you is the ability for the Yeta Wrench to safely help pick up machines without breaking them. Just Sneak + Right Click the wrench on an Ender IO machine and it will quickly secure it for storage and transport.
    Given that we will be needing more materials for the bigger machines soon, we also have a tool for your SAG Mill called the Dark Steel Grinding Ball. Instead of Flint, you can form Dark Steel into a ball and place it into the SAG Mill. It will both last longer and have better chance of finding extra materials.
    The Experience Rod allows you to 'deposit' your experience in liquid form into a Fluid Tank or other liquid vessel if you Sneak + Right Click. You can retrieve experience by just Right Clicking it on the container.
    Aside from these, we have some newer tools my assistants and I have come up with. They aren't much, but... well, you'll see. These Buffers enable you to create a 'transfer point' between different power or item transport systems. The Item Buffer can hold 9 items, while the Energy Buffer can hold 100k RF. You can combine them into an Omni Buffer as well that does both.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Enlightened Transparency
questDatabase.description:
The Fused Quartz we made using your world's materials seems much stronger than the similar product we can make here. This got my assistants considering more possibilities with the material, so one of them attempted to mix powdered Glowstone into the molten quartz, and came out with a type of Fused Quartz that emits its own light! We call it Enlightened Fused Quartz.
    We then tried the same thing with Quite Clear Glass, and got quite similar results with this Enlightened Clear Glass.
    Please provide my assistants some samples of both of these, we've got some interesting things in the works here.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Magical Machines
questDatabase.description:
By what my assistants have shown and taught me, my earlier questioning of whether Magic really exists in your world or not is answered: it does, and apparently in spades. 
    We've examined the Enchanting Table you are able to make with your world's materials, and we've determined its a bit too... random... for our liking. While I had my assistants researching deeper into this inherent magic, I've drawn up some blueprints using materials used in the construction of the original Enchanting Table, but fused with my (and now your) knowledge of sturdy, dependable machinery. What we've come up with is simply called an Enchanter, and it will let you Enchant a Book and Quill, instead of a tool or piece of armor. Instead of the random nature, by using a specific item as a catalyst and expending some of your Experience, you can Enchant the book with specific attributes.
    Meanwhile, while researching these Zombies, we've found that even their heads can remain animated in strange ways. The assistants and I have come up with a way to keep the animated head powered with Nutrient Distilliation, around which we construct a shell of Fused Quartz and Dark Steel. We can then attach any kind of Sword to Killer Joe, as we've come to name him, and as long as he's fed Nutrients, he will hit nearby creatures with the sword. Any magical Enchantments on the Sword used by Killer Joe will take effect, but no experience will drop.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Gotta Catch Em Souls
questDatabase.description:
In researching some of the new materials we have discovered in our lab, one of the assistants stumbled upon an... interesting tool. With the talk of Souls and Magic and all that, he got the idea to make a small container of glass, or in this case Fused Quartz, and put a 'magical' lid on it, similar to how a few of the more occult research branches jar their components. 
    Well, his little test jar didn't seem to do anything until he went to fill it with some milk (fresh from the cow, for some reason...) to use in an experiment with The Vat, and instead the entire cow vanished. The vial was suddenly full of a glowy, wispy material, which turned out to be the cow, because when he uncorked it and upended the jar onto the ground, the cow popped back out immediately. Quite intriguing, so I beleive we shall call this unique find a Soul Vial.
    With a little knowledge sharing from one of the more esoteric Occult branches, we've developed a machine that'7ll let you manipulate certain... well, souls... that you collect. It is aptly named the Soul Binder.
    You can use the Soul Binder to return a captured Zombie soul into one of our Undead Logic processors called the Frank'N'Zombie.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The Third Tier
questDatabase.description:
You have definitely surpassed my expectations! All the components you have sent, along with all the designs you have replicated properly, have really shown you have the knowledge and penache for this field, Bandit. 
    Now, though, I was only going to show you the final tier of machinery I knew of, and teach you about Conduits, but... I believe it is time for both of us to embark on a new journey... research. The new materials from your Nether intrigue us a bit, but your Endermen intrigue us even more! Especially their ability to teleport! 
    If we can harness this power for an inventory logistics system... the entirety of The Business could benefit!

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Highest Grade Components
questDatabase.description:
With the research speeding along well on the unique properties of Ender Pearls, and the Alloys we have made from them, we can go one step higher than our previous tier of components! 
    Before now, Double-Layer Capacitors were one of the best we could make, without using extremely rare, unique materials that is. By encasing Glowstone in Double-Layer Capacitors bound with Vibrant Alloy, we can make quite powerful Octadic Capacitors. 
    Now, we know the power of crystalline structures. It is what gives Fused Quartz such strength, after all. Crystals, gems, all have a lot of uses in an engineering setting, but even more so it seems when you begin to involve Magic in some sort. We can encompass the scope of Technology and Magic by coating gemstones with some of our Alloys. A diamond can be coated with small pieces of Pulsating Iron to make a Pulsaing Crystal, and an Emerald can be coated with small pieces of Vibrant Alloy to make a Vibrant Crystal. Using fewer nuggets of Pulsating Iron can make a Weather Crystal instead.
    The Soul Binder can further our crystalline research. A Villager Soul can be bound to an Emerald to make an Enticing Crystal, or an Enderman soul to a Vibrant Crystal to make an Ender Crystal. The resulting Crystals will be perfect for the new set of machines and tools I have ideas for. 
    If you could send only one of each of these to us, please, we have plenty in the works that should help both of us.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Dark Tools
questDatabase.description:
Dark Steel is quite a useful metal, extremely strong and durable. And since you are creating it with materials from your current world, it has a bit of magical properties to it. By shaping the metal into tools or Armor, you can get the same protection as basic Iron, but more durable like the crystalline structure of Diamond. 
    You can then take each Dark Steel piece to an Anvil and imbue it with an item (remember the 'magical' properties I mentioned?). Inspect each piece closely, such as the Dark Helm, and it you will be able to tell what you can imbue it with. 
    The Ender is excellent at beheading certain enemies, as well as quite effective at damaging Endermen.
    The Dark Pick and Dark Axe are fantastic tools, very durable.
    The Dark Steel Anvil lasts a lot longer than a normal Iron one does.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Powered Up
questDatabase.description:
After researching both the Ender infused Crystals we've created, and the inherent magicalness of your tools, we've found a perfect way to power up your Dark Steel tools by placing a Vibrant Crystal into them on an Anvil to Empower them. They gain the ability to hold RF Energy like a battery. This will not only make the tool at the level of Diamond, as long as they are powered they gain extra abilities. Make four Vibrant Crystals while I explain what some of the special Powered properties are.
    Empowered Dark Armor, like the Dark Helm, will absorb some of the damage you take at the cost of RF Energy.
    Striking an Enderman with an Empowered The Ender will disable its ability to teleport for a short bit.
    If you are crouching when you cut the base of a tree with the empowered Dark Axe, up to around 50 meters of Wooden Logs will break and fall down as well, as long as they were all touching each other. The empowered Dark Pickaxe, while powered, will mine much faster.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Improved Power Systems
questDatabase.description:
These new materials vastly increases our potential for generating Energry. Not only generating it, but storing it as well. We've come up with an improvement on that old Photovoltaic Cell blueprint I showed you how to make earlier, and this Advanced Photovoltaic Cell should be quite superior. With this and your other Power generators, along with the use of Energy Conduits, its much easier to make large Power Generation setups to power your home, base, or whichever you have constructed to survive out there with. 
    We've also come up with an expandable Energy Storage solution for you, and a way to monitor your Power Network to make sure everything is running fine. They come in three tiers : Basic Capacitor Bank, Capacitor Bank, and Vibrant Capacitor Bank. These Capacitor Banks can be placed and combined into larger and larger structures. The larger the Capacitor bank you've made, the more it stores and the higher its Input/Output is.
    With you creating networks of Power Conduits, I think it would be a smart idea to create a Power Monitor. With it, you'll be able to see how much Energy your network is storing, how much is being used, and you can even have it send out a Redstone signal depending on how much Energy you have. This is an excellent way to turn on a set of Generators if, say, your power dropped below a certain point. Be sure to attatch the Monitor to your network by a Power Conduit, otherwise it won't be able to read the network.
    We also have something to wirelessly recharge items you are carrying that run off RF Energy. The Wireless Charger can recharge tools in your inventory up to twenty blocks away.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The Arteries of Logistics
questDatabase.description:
Now that you know how to make certain materials and certain machines, it seems a good a time as any to teach you how the blood flows in the Input, Output system of an inventory logistics system. By which, I mean Conduits! With them, you can pipe not only liquids like water, but Energy as well! 
    Your Yeta Wrench is an invaluable tool when working with Conduits. They can go along floors, up and down walls, and can be tucked away in plain sight. A single bundle of Conduits can hold one of each kind of Conduit. To view only ONE type, hold your Yeta Wrench and Sneak + Mouse Wheel to scan through the Conduit types
    We make and run quite a variety of Conduits: 
    Redstone Conduit transmits Redstone Signals that pass through them. Insulated Redstone Conduit allows you to run multiple Conduits side by side, and control which side of the Conduit transmits the signal. Similar to a Lever, the Conduit Switch allows you to turn on and off a Signal to a Redstone Conduit network.
    Energy Conduits transfer power.
    Fluid Conduits move liquids around. Gravity effects how fast fluids can flow through these basic Fluid Conduits.
    Gas Conduits are used to pipe strong gasses. This is a specialized Conduit for moving around Mekanism gasses.
    You can hide bundles of Conduits by making Conduit Facades and painting them in the Painting Machine. When you hold your Yeta Wrench, all Facades will become invisible.
    You can scan your Conduit networks for how much power is transmitting through part of it, or how much a specific Machine is taking, using a Conduit Probe. It can also copy Connection settings of some conduits by holding Sneak and using your Mousewheel to select the setting, and then Sneak + Right Clicking to copy a connection's settings. Right clicking on another connection will paste the settings to it.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Enhanced Conduits
questDatabase.description:
Basic Conduits are good for smaller networks. They can pipe around enough for a handful of machines, a few faucets, etc. When you need to go bigger, though, you run into a few issues: not enough throughput, so not enough Energy or Liquid or whatnot will get to all the machinery you want. 
    Time wasted is money wasted, right? So we have some more advanced Conduits you can make, and hopefully if my assistants finish their current projects, even better Conduits for you!
    The Enhanced Energy Conduit transmits much more energy over time.
    Not only will the Pressurized Fluid Conduit pump Fluid much faster, it will also negate the effect of Gravity on the piping fluid!

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Custom Conduits
questDatabase.description:
Being able to transport items like this is fantastic, but at the scale of operation The Ferret Business works at, we are always in need of improving logistics designs. Item Conduits are fantasic for transporting materials, especially in large quantities. We've come up with a good variety of ways to augment your Item Conduits, from speeding them up to filtering the items that pass through them. These upgrades can be added to the point where a Conduit connects to an Inventory.
    The simplest way to improve an Item Conduit is to speed it up. The Item Conduit Speed Upgrade will increase the number of items a Conduit can pull from an Inventory. Each conduit can accept up to 15 of these Upgrades.
    Item Conduits are fantasic for transporting materials, especially in large quantities. Sometimes, though, we need to control what they take from or put into an inventory. With the Basic Item Filter, you can define up to five items, and the Conduit will only grab or put those items in that inventory.
    The Basic Filter is good and all, but sometimes you need a bit more control over what the Conduit will and will not accept. With the Advanced Item Filter, you can filter up to double the number of items (10 of them, that is), and also filter items that match within the Dictionary, for such things as Ores that are more or less the same.
    Filting specific items into a new inventory system is helpful, but what happens if you have an organised inventory system already set up, and want to sort like that? You can use the Existing Item Filter to take a Snapshot of the inventory's contents at the press of a button!
    Specific Labs here at The Business have requested a way for them to more broadly define how we can filter items. The Mod Item Filter can be set to accept only items from specific Modifications. You can choose up to three seperate Modification tags, and the Filter will only move items from those Mods.
    The Chargeable Item Filter enables you to sort by how much power an item has stored.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Pipe for Product
questDatabase.description:
One of the early systems we used to use in The Business, before networked computers and the like came along, was pressurized tube system, in which pill-like containers were shunted along the network of pipes. It was usually used for inter-office communication, sending reports to the central office, shipping tiny parcels around. This severely limited its use, especially when phones and better communication methods came along, and the tubes were quickly taken down and shelved. 
    With these Ender alloys, we have dusted off the old blueprints and designs (the tubes themselves had long ago been repurposed for animal habitat decoration), and created an amazing Conduit. By lining tubes made of Pulsating alloy bound with Conduit Binder, you create an Item Conduit that uses the teleportative powers of Ender to transfer items of any size and shape along an Item Conduit network. 
    When connected to an inventory, you can right click the connection to configure it, add upgrades, and more.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Enderic Transfering
questDatabase.description:
All these various conduits that use the power of the Endermen's teleportation ability has sparked quite an idea amongst our lab. We can teleport fluids and items along a line of Conduits... why can we not do away with the Conduits themselves? We're already teleporting things, the Conduits merely provide a given path between Point A and Point B. 
    So, to this end, we have constructed a machine. By assigning a designation to it, we can then assign the SAME designation to a second one of these Dimensional Transceiver machines, and any items, fluids, or power we pipe through our Conduits into it will transfer between the two. The parts are fairly time consuming and expensive for a pair of these, but worth every pretty coin's worth. 
    You can even make a specialized Ender Rail in your Soul Binder, which will teleport a minecart between the two Dimensional Tranceivers. You must place this on top of a Dimensional Traceiver. You can then set the destination in the Tranceiver. Sneak + Right Click to change its direction.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Endearing Conduits
questDatabase.description:
We have been doing lots of testing and research with these new alloys we all have come up with. The Ender infused alloys we've made have really pushed our IO sysem forward. Since a big use of our Conduits is Fluid and Energy pumping, I figured that we should see if we can improve on our design a bit. 
    I believe we can utilize the teleportation properties of our Ender infused alloys. With these improved Ender Energy Conduits, you can pipe massive amounts of Energy along them and the Ender Fluid Conduits directly teleport Fluids to their destination, allowing you to pipe multiple fluids on the same Conduit. Both of these should keep your Conduit networks nice and compact. 
    We've also been working closely with another branch of The Ferret Business to come up with new Conduits, resulting in two new ones that would interface nicely with their system. The ME Conduit and ME Dense Conduit can be used to run ME cabling alongside your Conduits, making sure all your designs are nice and compact.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Enderic Tools
questDatabase.description:
Since the discovery of the Vibrant and Pulsating Crystals, all of my assistants have been hard at work helping me to harness the power of Ender. We've created a pair of items that should be quite useful to you. 
    The Electromagnet, when Powered and used, will draw items dropped on the ground towards you. This should be useful around your workshop.
    The Staff of Traveling should be even more useful. Sneak + Right Clicking while holding the Staff of Traveling will recreate a controlled Endermen teleport, propelling you forward a short distance instantly.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Input, Output, Ender
questDatabase.description:
I believe we've found our penultimate tool, the device that will define our Research Lab for years to come. I present to you the EnderIO. By encasing an Eye of Ender with Electrical Steel and Fused Quartz, we can access it with either a Staff of Travel or by standing on a Travel Anchor. 
    When we do, our vision is shifted to the Anchor, seeing in a 7 square meter radius around it. Not only that, but we can remotely interact with everything in this vision area. We can pull levers, open chests and take items out or put items in, interact in any way with placed items. This opens up so many possibilities for The Ferret Business, both good and bad. 
    To that end, you are able to limit who can access your EnderIO, whether you lock it to yourself, or setting a password on it. 
    Along with the EnderIO, we have also created another useful device called the Travel Anchor, which you can interface with or without a Staff of Traveling. Just by standing on a Travel Anchor, you can see all other Travel Anchors around you, look towards one, and Jump to it. If you are holding up your Staff of Traveling, you can see them no matter what you are standing on.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Improved Fixtures
questDatabase.description:
With the new materials we've created in the Alloy Smelter, we can improve on an older design, as well as show you some new designs that should be quite useful around a workshop. By utilizing Dark Steel and Fused Quartz instead of Iron and Glass, these devices fully utilize the properties of both. 
    Not only does the Pressurized Fluid Tank hold twice as much, its also fairly blast resistant. Good for when handling unstable materials!
    This special Reinforced Obsidian is HIGHLY resistant to certain types of efffects: more specifically, the destructived nature of the strange monster your QUEST Tablet calls The Wither.
    The Fused Quartz Frame can be placed into a Painting Machine to customize the look, and then placed on many of the special types of Quartz Glass I've shown you how to make.
    A normal Pressure Plate will send a Redstone Signal when anything lands on it. The Dark Steel Pressure Plate will only send one if you or one of your assistants stands on it. It can also be painted in a Painting Machine, and if you paint it with Quite Clear Glass, it will be more or less invisible!
    You move up and down Dark Steel Ladders faster than normal ladders.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Powerful Machines
questDatabase.description:
These new Crystals have quite a wide variety of uses. We've dug out some of our old blueprints we don't use anymore to help give us some ideas, and we've come up with a handful of new machines for your use that utilize just a bit of the immense potential of these Crystals.
    The Vacuum Chest will draw in any dropped items close to it and store them if it has room.
    Supply the Farming Station with power and tools and it can automatically till, plant, and harvest both plants and trees.
    Something I noticed from the initial data from your world are these... strange contraptions, from which monsters spring out. Deeper scans of these things have shown them to be somewhat unstable, and removing it will most likely break it...but I think we can take this broken contraption and combine it with this new Powered Spawner on an Anvil to create a new, working one.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Obelisk, Cooperate!
questDatabase.description:
We now have a large pile of specialized crystals we can use, but we need a special sort of machine to utilize them, and I believe we have come up with just the thing. Taking some notes from the occult branches of The Business, we've come up with a machine version of an Obelisk, or totem, which can do a variety of things, depending on which crystal or item you construct the Obelisk with.
    Attractor Obelisks draw creatures nearby to it, if they match one of the Souls stored inside the Obelisk.
    When supplied with power and the appropriate Catalyst, this Weather Obelisk can change the weather for you.
    Using one of the special Endermen logic processors, we can make an Aversion Obelisk, which will allow you to 'dissuade' creatures from appearing close to it, as long as you have placed a Soul Vial containing a similar soul into the Obelisk.
    The Experience Obelisk allows you to give or take Experience, and pump it in liquid form out (or into) the Obelisk.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Alternate Enderic Inventory
questDatabase.description:
Now, we have spent quite a bit of time researching all this new technology we've created, but as they say, there is always "Science to be Done!". 
    We've gotten a few more excellent advancements in item storage and transport for you. We've harnessed the intellect and other worldly power of the Ender to create a sort of inventory network you can access from a remote computer. 
    To start with this new inventory system, you'll need to break out your Slice n' Splice and imbue a Witch's soul into an Ender Resonator to give it the proper intelligence.
    By inserting the Remote Awareness upgrades into Item Conduits, the inventories that are directly connected become searchable and accessable along the entire network!
    Attach the Inventory Panel to any Item Conduit on a network. The Sentient Ender inside of it will be able to see and access all inventories that are connected to a Remote Awareness Upgrade. You can search for items and even craft from this panel! Do note, it will require Nutrient Distillation to function... it DOES have to eat something.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Compact Machines
questDatabase.description:
What every mechanic, good or bad, realizes really quickly is... you just don't have the space for all your tools and machines! Sure, you can get a bigger shop, a second shop, a fifth shop, an aircraft hangar, an entire apartment building even, but it still just won't be enough space! Plus, if you get yourself a huge space, you still have to wire everything up, and worry about zoning permits and... where was I?
    Oh, right! Well, we like to employ something we call Meek's Law : The potential effectiveness of any factory or machine increases as its footprint decreases. Which means... the smaller you make it, the more efficient it can become. And what better way to make something super effecient than by shrinking them down!
    The Atom Enlarging Module and the Atom Shrinking Module are the basis of making super Compact Machines. They are kind of like Capacitors or Coils, they don't really do much until you put them into a machine.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Unnamed
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Piecing It Together
questDatabase.description:
Okay, you got the Enlarger and Shrinker, right? Now we'll need to put them into a larger device before they are useable. What, you expected to just slap the module like a sticker on something and POOF, smaller! Course not, it'd shrink and then you'd need a magnifying glass to even see it! Then you'd also need a pair of tweezers, and a tiny tiny Enlarging Module to make it normal size again, and shoes just in case you did drop a few shrunken machines in the carpet... mechanical caltrops, that's what we'd call them!
    Er, continuing... The World Resizing Interface lets the Compact Machine shrink and expand whatever passes through it.
    By building a cube of World Resizing Interfaces around a Diamond, you create the basis of the Compact Machine: the World Resizing Cube. This lets you pipe in power, liquid, and items in and out of every side of the Compact Machine.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Is So Tiny!
questDatabase.description:
Your Compact Machine is almost complete, don't worry! Now you just need to build a case for it. Lots of materials work fine, but we'll start with the cheapest : wooden planks! 
    I know, for a machine it seems an odd choice, but wood tends to go in and out of style for some reason, even for machines. Wood and the World Resizing Cube will make the tiniest Compact Machine you can get, but even that provides you a lot of space! Inside this Machine is its own miniaturized space. You can place it in your base, and each side can have RF Power, Items, and Fluids pumped in and out them.
    To enter and leave a Compact Machine, you'll need your own Personal Shrinking Device. Craft it, and then Right Click it onto the Machine itself to enter it. Now you are inside the Compact Machine! Any items you bring into it are shrunk with you, and this includes other Machines so you can place it inside!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
