When you place the machine down, the front will be facing away from you. You can later rotate a machine with your Precision Sledgehammer or any machine Wrench. Keep in mind that most MFR Machines require Power as well.
    Place the planter one block below a 3x3 area of the appropriate soil. It will plant seeds and saplings in its inventory, and where you place it in the inventory is where it will plant it. If you place an Oak Sapling in the top center of the inventory, it will plant it on the North Center block.
    The Fertilizer will scan a 3x3 area in front of it for crops and saplings, applying Industrial Fertilizer to them. Normally, this would just speed up the plants' growth a little bit, it seems that your world's magical materials will quite regularly grow the crops or trees with very little time or Fertilizer required.
    The Planter can only plant crops. To harvest them, you will need a Harvester. This machine will scan a 3x3 area in front of it and harvest trees and crops. Each plant it harvests will generate a little Sludge, which will fill its internal tank. If the tank is full, the machine will work much slower.
    Many machines like the Harvest generate Sludge as they work. You can Pipe this waste material out and into a Sludge Boiler, which will reduce it into one of a number of different materials.
    Place the Fisher directly above a 3x3x1 or larger pool of water and it will automatically fish for you. Strangely, if it detects another Fisher close by, it will jam up and refuse to work properly until the other Fisher is removed.
    The Fruit Picker will scan a 3x3x21 area in front of it for fruit to pick off of trees, like hanging Apples or Cocoa Beans. It will not replant them, though, you will still need a Planter for that.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Farming the Barnyard
questDatabase.description:
Simple plants aren't the only living things we deal with here, and I don't mean our clients and shoppers. Farm animals provide many things we need, whether its meat, fur, wool, milk, or other such things. These machines though... they seem to work strangely with your materials. Sometimes better, sometimes just in unexpected ways. I mean, animals from your world seem to be able to give birth to a baby in no time and all, and that baby grows up within days!
    When supplied with the appropriate food (wheat for cows, carrots for pigs, etc), the Breeder will scan a 5x5 area in front of it and breed appropriate animal pairs when possible.
    The Rancher scans a 5x5 area in front of it for animals it can harvest from. For example, it can milk cows, and either send the milk out a connected Pipe, or fill a bucket if you supply it. It will shear Sheep, gather Eggs from Chickens, and even get soup from those unique fungal creatures you call Mooshrooms if you give it some Bowls!
    If you've got a large barnyard full of animals giving birth at different times, it can be difficult to split off the young to a safer location. Using the Chronotyper, you can select either Adult or Young animals, and it will scan a 5x5 area in front of it for the appropriate aged animal, and then move it behind the machine.
    The Grinder seems like a dark task for something to undertake, but the truth is most of us eat meat. The Grinder quickly kills creatures in a 5x5 area in front of it, picking up any useable materials from it and stores them in its inventory. It also seems to collect this... mysterous glowing green liquid. For now, we're going to call it Essence, as it seems to be the Essence of the creatures it kills...

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Advanced Animal Farming
questDatabase.description:
We can do a whole lot more with a farm full of animals than just breed and kill them. Utilizing them to help create more materials for plant farming is one way, but we can also utilize nearly the entire animal, wasting nothing, which I feel should be one of the goals of a fully functioning factory.
    The Sewer collects waste from animals that walk on the 1x1 area above it. Larger animals produce more Sewage. It will jam up if there is another Sewer close to it, unfortunately, but the upside is it seems to slowly generate Essence as well.
    Supplied with Sewage from a Sewer (or if you find a dumping ground of it...), the Composter will convert it into Industrial Fertilizer.
    The Slaughterhouse scans a 5x4x5 cube in front of it for creatures. It will kill them and process almost the entire thing into Liquid Meat and Pink Slime. Liquid Meat can be Piped out of any side of the machine, but Pink Slime will require special pipes, such as Fluiducts with Pneumtic Servos from Thermal Dynamics to extract. 
    The Meat Packer converts Liquid Meat into Raw Meat Ingots, and Pink Slime into Raw Meat Nuggets. These can then be cooked and consumed.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Liquid Factor
questDatabase.description:
A factory needs to be able to work with liquid matter as well as solid objects. I mean, how else are you going to get soup into cans, soda into bottles, or jelly into jars? Most of these machines had some limited uses before, but I've found with your magical  materials, they are a bit more useful!
    Each Plastic Tank stores up to 4 buckets of liquid. When you place multiple of them next to each other horizontally, they will connect. Tanks will not connect vertically, allowing you to stack different liquids on top of each other.
    You can pipe almost any liquid into the Fountain, and it will pump it onto the top of the machine. This includes Lava. 
    The Weather Collector is able to catch large amounts of Water or Snow in any climate but a desert. When it Rains, it will generate Water, but if its snowing, it will generate Snowballs.
    Normally, the LiquiCrafter would be able to store a single liquid and create objects that required it... but your special materials enabled me to improve it! You can now store up to 9 different liquids and automatically craft items that require those liquids. You can pipe liquids into any side, objects INTO the machine on any side, and OUT of the machine via the top or bottom.
    If you are piping around a lot of different liquids, the Liquid Router might well be a big help. You can filter what liquids go through this, which side the exit out on when piped in.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Improved Farming
questDatabase.description:
Growing plants and animals the traditional way has worked for thousands of years, but this is the age of technology. Well, and magic, in your current world. So, to move with the times, we need to improve on older practices!
    Fertile Soil is tilled farmland that is rich in nutrients and does not need to be watered.
    The Veterinary Station applies Syringes to a 5x5 area in front of it. There are many Syringes you can use, and they all start with an Empty Syringe : 
      Health Syringes will heal creatures
      Slime Embiggening Syringes do what it says on the tin, more or less : using one on a Slime will cause it to grow larger.
      Growth Syringes will instantly grow Baby animals into Adult animals. 
      Zombie Syringes can be used instead to do the same thing, but it DOES kind of have a... slight... chance of turning them into a Zombie instead.
      De-Zombification Syringes can turn your accident-prone Villager friends back to normal after they've been turned into a Zombie.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Colorful and Useful
questDatabase.description:
Plastic, Metal, and Glass aren't the only things we tend to use in a factory. We use Ceramic as well, as it tends to hold color pigment very well and doesn't rub off. 
    If we juts used straight dye, it could easily wear down and rub off, and then it'd get into the stuff we're producing. That wouldn't be very good Quality Control, would it? Mix Clay and Dye to make Ceramic Dye.
    Can use Ceramic Dye to make Stained Glass in various colors, and make stained glass panes.
    Roads are useful for designating a safe walking path in or around a factory. They also enable those who travel on them to move around as if they were on Ice, moving faster even when jumping.
   Road Lights are modified Roads, adding a light to them that can be turned on with a Redstone Signal. You can also invert this function to keep them always lit.

display:10.Name:8: Any Color Ceramic Dye
Any Color Stained Glass
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Magically Pink and Slimy
questDatabase.description:
You know the Slaughterhouse, and the Pink Slime it creates as a byproduct of making Liquid Meat? Yeah, well... we started doing a little testing with it, and it seems that its a concentrated bit of magic from your world. Fancy that! We got a real shock in our testing factory when an assistant accidently poured a bucket of Pink Slime onto the floor, and out popped a bouncing cube... with a face. It, unfortunately, bounced right into the Grinder pen...
    Slaughterhouses produce Pink Slime, which you can pipe out and fill Buckets with. By pouring a Pink Slime Bucket into the world, a Pink Slime will spawn.
    Killing a Pink Slime will sometimes net you a Pink Slimeball. If you have a way of growing a Slime and making it Bigger, you could probably get a lot more Pink Slimeballs from a single Slime.
    Combine a bunch of Pink Slimeballs and it forms into a Pink Slime Cube. It's not alive, thankfully, but you can then Smelt it into a Pink Slime Crystal. This should be useful for SOMETHING!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Set and Smash
questDatabase.description:
Sometimes a factory needs to break down materials as part of the process of making something. These machines will allow you to automatically place and break materials.
    Every 20 seconds, the Block Placer will scan the spot right in front of it. If it's empty, it will place a block from its inventory.
    The Block Breaker scans the area right in front of it, breaking any material it finds. It can break Obsidian, but not something like Bedrock.
    The Block Smasher things like Ores into their Mined products, like Redstone Ore into Redstone. Can simulate Fortune enchantment, but this requires Essence to be pumped into the machine.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Lasers? Lasers!
questDatabase.description:
Okay, we've been doing some experiments with that Pink Slime, specifically the Crystals you can make. We've taken an old factory machine for drilling holes and.... upgraded it. We might have combined this cool laser thing we had in storage with it as well. What we've ended up with is a super powerful Laser Drill!
    This baby takes a lot of power and materials, but when it is made out of your crazy magical materials, it allows us to mine areas that, before, were beyond our reach. I am talking of the areas under the indestructable Bedrock. Below that is what we call Void, which can destroy anything, but we've scanned beyond the Void and found riches... riches that the Drill can grab.
    To power the Drill itself, you'll need Laser Prechargers, up to 4 of them to be exact. They need to be placed North, South, East, and West of the main Drill, with 1 block of space in-between. Each of these requires power.
    The Laser Drill needs to have empty air between it and Bedrock or the dark Void of a world. It also needs at least one Laser Precharger set up. When it is functioning, it will fire a concentrated beam of energy straight down. Note that we tried to calculate the immense energy of this beam... but we ran out of numbers. I think it can kill even Gods if they aren't careful...
    Laser Foci increases the chance of certain Ores spawning. The color of the Focus 'usually' corresponds with the color of the Ore, but not always. You'd figure Yellorium would be Yellow... but it isn't. Weird.

display:10.Name:8: Any Color Laser Focus
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Decorative Elements
questDatabase.description:
Plastic is a wonderful material. Its cheap to make, sturdy, and easily repairable and replacable. This gives us a lot of options, not only for machines, but for design and decoration. I mean, who wants to work in a drab, lifeless factory? Theres lots of ways to make things look more interesting!
    A Block of Plastic is quite simple and a little elegant. It's also a great way to store lots of Plastic.
    Bricks give a really rustic feel to things, I feel, and making Large Bricks, or Large Paved Stone Bricks, look fantastic!
    Why stop at Stone and Clay? If you got factory workers who really like the cold (maybe you hired some penguins, dood!), you can make some Large Snow Bricks!
    For a little Yin and Yang to your factories, you can make Large Obsidian Bricks and Large Glowstone Bricks.
    Lapis is a pretty common gem, and Large Lapis Bricks is a pretty block!
    Plain Stone too... Gray? You can turn Stone and Gravel into a much lighter shade! Large Whitestone Bricks, Smooth Whitestone, and Whitestone Gravel are just some examples.
    If bright constructions aren't your thing, you can also make Stone and Gravel like the night! Large Blackstone Bricks, Smooth Blackstone, and Blackstone Gravel are the counter examples.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Upgraded Machines
questDatabase.description:
Further testing into the magical nature of your materials has resulted in the creation of what I call Upgrades. Many of these factory machines can take them, and each one will increase the range of the machine a certain amount! That means you can increase the range of your Farmers, or Breeders, etc! 
    Keep in mind, though, that some machines cannot work properly if it detects another machine like it in its range.
    The Upgrades are as follows : 
      Cobble decreases radius by 1
      Lapis - +1 Radius
      Tin - +2 Radius
      Iron - +3 Radius
      Copper - +4 Radius
      Bronze - +5 Radius
      Silver - +6 Radius
      Gold - +7 Radius
      Quartz - +8 Radius
      Diamond - +9 Radius
      Platinum - +10 Radius
      Emerald - +11 Radius

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Factory Built
questDatabase.description:
There are a lot of things you can automate the creation of in a factory. Some of these things you need to do other things, such as fix up worn down tools, or create fuel for engines. 
    We've also been experimenting more with your magical materials, and we've definitely improved on some of these designs! We've even found some uses for that magical Essence we discovered with the Grinder!
    Normally you'd take a broken down tool to an Anvil, apply some metal to it, and you'd get a mostly repaired tool back, but a little degraded, since you're really just patching it up. Not with the Auto Anvil. Supply it with some Essence, and it will automatically repair tools to pristine condition if you supply it with the proper repair material as well.
    Usually the Auto Brewer would be used to ferment alcoholic beverages... but we've upgraded the design a bit. Now you can use it to automatically brew magical Potions! Every row in the Auto Brewer represents a single ingredient step, starting from the top and working its way down. Usually you start with a Water Bottle, then go down the list.
    I'm not sure what the original design of this machine was for, but one of our Assistants came up with something that might help you. Giving this Lava Fabricator power will allow it to slowly generate... you guessed it, Lava!
    Lots of plant matter can be broken down into biological components via the BioReactor, into what we call BioFuel. The more of a single item you break down at a time, the more efficient the process is.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Power Generation
questDatabase.description:
Up until now, you've probably been powering your factory machines with any ol' generator. Whatever works is fine, but you might be interested there are a few MFR specific generators you can take advantage of!
    Pipe Water and supply some solid Fuel (like Coal) into the Steam Boiler and it will generate super hot Steam for you.
    The Steam you generated can be Piped into the Steam Turbine to generate power.
    The BioFuel Generator consumes BioFuel Piped into it, converting it into power.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Auto Magika
questDatabase.description:
The magical nature of your world gives everyone here at The Business amazing, wonderful ideas. We all have so much to research and experiment with! I have a few enchanting things that should be of great use, and will definitely broaden the types of factories we can make!
    Records from your world are... fairly mysterious. They are old school vinyl style, but have lots of potential. This Auto Jukebox can automatically play any Record piped into it. A Redstone Pulse will turn it on or off. If you supply it with a Blank Record as well, it can make a copy.
    The Auto-Disenchanter will extract a random Enchantment from any enchanted item you insert into it, placing it into a Book. It requires a Book and a bit of power to do this. Careful, as this can damage the original item.
    If you need more items to Disenchant, you can use the Auto-Enchanter. Supply it with some Essence and things to Enchant, it will automatically Enchant them up to level 30.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Automated Rails
questDatabase.description:
Some of our factories are large enough that just piping things everywhere isn't as efficient or, frankly, fun! They employ various different methods of transporting finished goods around, and one of them is Minecarts. They use specialized tracks that enable them to move inventory and even creatures in and out of Minecarts!
    Cargo Pickup Rails will move cargo from an inventory next to the track into the minecart if it has an inventory. Cargo Dropoff Rails will move items from the minecart inventory into an adjacent chest.
    Passenger Pickup Rails place nearby creatures into a minecart when it passes over the rail, while the Passenger Dropoff Rail removes them from the minecart.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: A Loaded Factory
questDatabase.description:
Factories tend to deal with thousands, if not millions, of a single material if it is efficient and large enough. Storing things efficiently is always difficult, but we've found a solution for you. By utilizing the extra-dimensional properties of Endermen Eyes, we can do wonders with four dimensional space in a three dimensional world! 
    How? By folding time upon itself in various ways, we can create larger pockets of space... but with some limitations, I have to say. We're still working on it...
    The Deep Storage Unit can store only a single type of item at a time... but it can store up to 2 BILLION of that item! When you dismantle or break the machine, all its contents stay with it as well!
    Your world's land and machines don't seem to keedp functioning if no one is nearby, they sort of... freeze in time. This Chunk Loader solves that. It can 'load' an area at the cost of either Liquid Fuel or RF Power, and that cost can be reduced by pumping in Liquid Ender or Essence into the machine.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Cabled
questDatabase.description:
Redstone Dust is a fairly old way of transmitting an electrical signal. It has limitations, as it can only be placed on the floor, and a signal can only go 15 blocks before it is too weak and needs to be refreshed. This is normally known as the Redstone Signal Strength. 
    With RedNet cable, the Signal Strength that goes into the cable is kept, and can go as many blocks as you need. This also gives us the basis for transfering not only Redstone Signals, but RF Energy as well!
    Along with transmitting Redstone Signal any distance, it also can transmit strength up to 120, if any machine outputs a signal that high. Each cable has 16 Color Channels it can be on, which can be cycled by holding a Precision Sledgehammer or any machine wrench and Right Clicking on the colored ring.
    Like the Factory Blocks, your magical materials seem to improve RedNet Energy Cables. They convert some alternate power types into RF. It can also transmit RF at 1000 per tick.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Programming Your Factory
questDatabase.description:
Automated conveyor belts and machines can only get you so far when you want to make a fully automated, efficient factory. To that end, you're going to need to bring a bit of computer logic into the mix. 
    This is the Programmable RedNet Controller. It allows you to create complex Redstone Circuits that can rely on Variables and Constants to function. This is a lot of power, and somewhat more complex than I can describe just through the tablet...
    Such a complex machine requires more in-depth instruction than I can provide. You can easily make the instruction manual yourself.

pages:9:
Programmable
        RedNet
      Controller

Owner's Manual v1.0


WARNING: YOU MAY NEED TO ADJUST YOUR GUI SCALE SMALLER TO APPROPRIATELY USE THIS PRODUCT
Congratulations on your purchase, assembly, or theft of your new Programmable RedNet Controller (PRC). This manual will attempt to guide you through its features and operations.

Features

* 16 I/O points on
  each side
* 16 internal
  variables
* 6 user-defined
  circuits
* Expandable with
  LX-100, 300, 500
  expansion modules
  (sold separately)

Circuits

The PRC is composed of one or more circuits. Each circuit is executed sequentially on every PRC clock cycle. Circuits are composed of inputs and outputs.

Circuits

Inputs can come from I/O, variables, or constant values. Outputs can be routed to I/O, variables, or null (disconnected). These options are discussed separately.

Circuits

All circuits default to No-Op when the PRC is initialized.

Constants

The PRC can use constant values for its inputs. It contains 16 constants, with values 0-15 in them.

I/O

Each face of the PRC can be connected to up to 16 I/O points. The front face cannot be connected, but the PRC can be rotated by using your standard sledgehammer.

I/O

Each I/O point is indicated by a color, ranging from white to black as per the standard elements. I/O inputs will update on the next PRC clock cycle.

Variables

The PRC contains variables that can be used by its circuits. Variables propagate between circuits on the same clock cycle; unlike the I/O delay.

Null

Route outputs to Null if you do not want to use the value.

GUI

The PRC GUI has four sections - from left to right they are input pins, circuit type, output pins, and circuit selection.

GUI: Circuit Type

Select a circuit type from the list to change the selected circuit in the PRC to that circuit type. Use the Next and Prev buttons to change which circuit is being edited.

GUI: Pin Mapping

PRC pins are connected in two parts, buffer and pin number. Buffer selects I/O and face, variables, constants, or null, as applicable. Pin chooses which I/O color, or which variable/constant.

GUI: Pin Mapping

Left click advances by one, and right click reverses by one. Middle click advances by 16 when using variables or constants (one for I/O).

RedNet Meter

Much like it can be used to read out values of RedNet cables, the RedNet Meter can be used to read out the state of the PRC's variables.

Memory Cards

If you need to back up your PRC or copy it to another PRC, use a memory card. Using a blank card on a PRC will copy its program, and using a programmed card will write its program.

Examples

The next sections cover some basic PRC scenarios. Face your PRC West with your sledgehammer before beginning. These examples assume access to some supplies (next page).

Examples

You will need:
* A few dozen cables
* Several levers
* Several buttons
* Several lamps
* A daylight sensor
* A piston
* A note block
* A sledgehammer

Example 1: AND gate

Connect RedNet cabling to the North face of your PRC, and place two levers and a lamp on the cable. Set the levers to Orange and Magenta with your sledgehammer.

Ex 1: AND gate

Open your PRC. Set circuit one to And (2 Input). Set the input I/Os to I/O N, Orange and Magenta, and the output to I/O N, White.

Ex 1: AND gate

Manipulate the levers. Watch the lamp. It will light when both levers are on and deactivate when they are turned off.

Ex 2: Timer

Connect RedNet cabling to the South face of your PRC, and attach a lamp to it. Open your PRC and set circuit 2 to Wave (Square). Set the input to CNST 40. Set the output to I/O S, White.

Ex 2: Timer

The lamp will blink about once per second. You can use the square wave generator for any device that requires an alternating redstone signal.

Ex 2: Timer

The PRC runs at a clock rate of 20 cycles per second. Adjust the period (Pd) of the timer to make it faster or slower. Values too fast (<5 t) may not work correctly with all devices.

Ex 3: Door Toggle

Connect cabling to the East face of your PRC. Attach a button to White and a piston to Orange. If you have extra parts, you may want to build a real door.

Ex 3: Door Toggle

Open your PRC and set circuit 3 to a T-FlipFlop. Connect I/O E, White to both inputs, and I/O E Orange to Q. Press the button.

Ex 3: Door Toggle

Note the piston extends and retracts on each button press. The T-FlipFlop samples the input value on a rising edge of CLK - if you don't care, connect both to the same input as here.

Ex 4: Daylight Sensor/Variables

Connect RedNet cabling to the top of your PRC. Attach a daylight sensor to White, and a note block to Orange. Set a pleasing tone on the note block.

Ex 4: Daylight Sensor/Variables

Open the PRC. Set circuit 4 to Equals, with I/O U White and CNST 3 as inputs, and the output to VARS 0. Set circuit 5 to a One-Shot Pulse, with input VARS 0 and output I/O U Orange.

Ex 4: Daylight Sensor/Variables

When the sun rises and sets, the daylight sensor's output level will reach 3. As it arrives at that value, the note block will be pulsed. Use it as an alarm clock!

Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Construct an "8" out of redstone lamps. It should look like this:
 XX 
X  X
X  X
 XX 
X  X
X  X
 XX 
Ensure no blocks connect the lamps.

Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Starting with the top section and proceeding clockwise, connect them as follows:  cyan, purple, blue, brown, green, red, black. Red should be the top-left pair and black the center pair.

Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Connect those wires to the top face of the PRC (along with the daylight sensor). Open the PRC, and set circuit 6 to Seven-Segment Encoder.

Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Connect I to I/O U White, and A through G to cyan through black in order. If you have wired everything correctly, the clock will display the current daylight value.

Ex 5: Daylight Clock

Note that as the daylight sensor has outputs 0-15, these are reprsented as hex characters as 0-9 and A-F.

Additional Suggestions

* Try the various wave generators connected to redstone dust
* Try using the counter - PRE is the rollover target.
* Try using weighted pressure plates combined with greater/less than.

Summary

Note that the examples all function independently, as the PRC has multiple circuits and can process many tasks at once. Amazing things can be accomplished using the PRC.
We hope you enjoy your new Programmable RedNet Controller!

questDatabase.name: RedNet Tools
questDatabase.description:
RedNet Cables and the Programmable Rednet Controller vastly improve the types of circuits you can make... and also vastly increases the steps you can mess up! To that, I have a bunch of tools you may be interested in when dealing with RedNet Cables, as well as a bonus machine that can only be fully utilized by a Programmable RedNet Controller!
    The RedNet Meter displays information when used on RedNet Cables, like Signal Strength. The RedNet Multimeter, though, is used on RedNet Energy Cables, and can also display things like power.
    The RedNet Historian can be connected to RedNet Cables to display the strength of a Redstone Signal that passes through it as a function of time.
    Noteblocks made of your magic materials are very odd. They only make sounds depending on the material they are on... but we can control this function with a RedNote Block! What note it plays can be controlled by what Strength a Redstone Signal is that hits it. It is also the only machine I know of that can detect Signal Strength above 15, which can only be obtained via a Programmable RedNet Controller and RedNet Cables.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Controller Upgrades
questDatabase.description:
A new RedNet Controller has limited circuits and variables it can hold. You can increase these by installing Logic Expansion Cards! There are three levels of Expansions, and each one can be stacked 3 times in a Controller.
    The PRC LX-100 Logic Expansion Card has 1 Circuit and 8 Variables.
    The PRC LX-300 Logic Expansion Card has 3 Circuits and 16 Variables.
    The PRC LX-500 Logic Expansion Card has 5 Circuits and 24 Variables.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Rockets!
questDatabase.description:
Here's a little special thing for you we came up with. We know how dangerous your world is, so we wanted to help you defend yourself. The scanner says some of the things you face are quite big and dangerous, and we have an answer to them : The SPAMR Rocket Launcher! This is a very destructive weapon, so be careful! 
    Self-Propelled Anti-Material Rockets fire only in a straight line.
    If you aim it at a target for a short time, it'll lock on, and Tracking Self-Propelled Anti-Material Rockets will track the locked-on target when you fire them.

questDatabase.name: A Little Fun
questDatabase.description: Hey, did you ever make a Potato Cannon when you were a kid? You know, some PVC pipe, an end cap, an igniter, a bit of hairspray, and a properly sized spud? What, really?! Well, you can make one now as well! The bonus is you don't really need hairspray, with your magical materials. Or a lighter. And the potatos might hurt a little more than before...

questDatabase.name: ADMIN GUIDE
questDatabase.description:
[Message From Caigan]
    Previously, this section contained quests to regain reputation after a book reset. This is no longer necessary.
    For administrative commands, pleasure refer to the FTB Utilities Guide, accessable from your inventory : 
    Open your inventory, and to the left of your portrait should be a book icon. This will open a Guide that explains much about this modpack, including a section for Administrative commands.

questDatabase.name: Awakened Armor
questDatabase.description: The strength and raw power of Awakened Draconium has plenty of uses, and easily the most useful for you would probably be to use it as armor, especially if you are looking to fight the Ender Dragons repeatedly.

questDatabase.name: Initial Signal
questDatabase.description:
So we've been testing some things with Draconium, looking to further our research. We've found lots of great things already, but also come across some small, relatively cheap devices that could help you.
    These are some fairly cheap items to make, especially when you consider how much the rest of this research is.
    First up, a Potentiometer, which can emit a variable strength Redstone Signal between 0 and 15.
    Then we have the Rain Sensor, which will emit a Redstone Signal when its, well... raining of course.
    Last we have the Player Detector, which will emit a Redstone Signal when you or another assistant gets within about 10 blocks.

questDatabase.name: A Pack of Draconics
questDatabase.description: I feel you'll probably be utilizing a lot of these in our research together. We can pack five of them into a single shipment through the QUEST Tablet for you.

questDatabase.name: Storage Drawers
questDatabase.description:
We like to employ various storage methods here in The Ferret Business, not just Industrial level ones. Workshops tend to use a lot of variety in their components, and prefer if each one is kept in its own storage container. This makes it easy to both catalog how much of an item you have left, but identify which container it is in with a simple picture label.
    To that end, we've devised a set of furniture that we simply label §4§lStorage Drawers§r, which come in a variety of shapes, sizes, and styles. To use, simply hold the item you want to store, and Right Click onto the front of the Drawer. It will add the items and put an icon on the front for easy identification. If you Double Right Click, you will add all of that item in your inventory.
    To remove items, Left Click the front of the Drawer to remove a single item. Sneak + Left Click will remove an entire stack.
    Drawers come in a variety of sizes. The basic Drawer is 1x1, and can hold 32 Stacks of a single item.
    You can make a drawer the same size, but partition it into either 1x2 (which holds 16 stacks per drawer), or 2x2 (which holds 8 stacks per drawer).

display:10.Name:8: Any 1x1 Drawer
Any 1x2 Drawer
Any 2x2 Drawer
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Basic Storage Upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Storage Drawers are able to be upgraded in various ways. The simplest set of upgrades deal with how many and how items stored are dealt with.
    All Upgrades start with the Upgrade Template. All actual Upgrades are simply to install : Simply Right Click it onto a Storage Drawer.
    Storage Upgrades come in multiple tiers, and each one multiplies the Max Stack amount. You don't need to start at the lowest tier of Storage Upgrade when applying them.
    The Void Upgrade will allow you to continue putting items into a Storage Drawer beyond its capacity, but any extra items will be destroyed.

display:10.Name:8: Any Drawer Storage Upgrade
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Lock and Key
questDatabase.description:
Controlling and organizing Storage Drawers in a lab environment is important. Securing personal storage, moving storage around, and more are important.
    Moving workshops is a common occurance in The Ferret Business. Whether you are moving departments, getting a bigger workshop, or just reorganizing things, it's easy to move Storage Drawers around. Packing Tape can be Right Clicked onto any Storage Drawer to 'seal' it. You can then break the Drawer without the contents spilling everywhere. You can then place the Drawers back down and they will automatically unseal.
    Locking drawers is important in a busy environment. A Drawer Key will 'lock' in the item in a drawer, so that even if you pull out every item, it will only accept that one again. The Concealment Key will show and hide the visual labels on drawers. Good if you want a more uniform looking workspace.
    Personal Keys will lock drawers from being able to be used by anyone but yourself. There are two types of Personal Key.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Redstone Upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Another level of upgrades that Storage Drawers can take deal with Redstone in various ways. 
    Status Upgrades will display an indicator on the front of the Drawer. Level I indicator will light up when the Drawer is full, while a Level II indicator will have an indicator bar that fills up as the Drawer fills up.
    Redstone Upgrades will make the Storage Drawers emit a Redstone Signal depending on the type. The basic Redstone Upgrade will emit a Redstone Signal depending on how full the Drawer is. The fuller it is, the higher the Redstone Signal Strength.
    Redstone Min Upgrade and Redstone Max Upgrade will emit a Redstone Signal when the Storage Drawer slot is either least full or most full.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Compact Storage Drawers
questDatabase.description:
Full sized block Drawers are nice, but sometimes either workshop space or aesthetics call for a slimmer design.
    Compact Storage Drawers come in two varieties : 1x2 and 2x2. Each holds half the amount of Stacks per drawer as their full sized counterparts.

display:10.Name:8: Any Compact 1x2 Drawer
Any Compact 2x2 Drawer
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Drawer Framing
questDatabase.description:
Storage Drawers can be visually customized in a variety of ways. This helps with organization and sorting methods at a glance, but also to help fit into a given setting better. 
    The first is the ability to make Trim, which are decorative blocks that look like Storage Drawers. You can, also, Sneak + Right Click it onto the Side or Back of any Storage Drawer to change it's wood type to the Trim's.
    For proper customization, you can make a Framing Table. This allows you to put any Framed Storage Drawer into it, along with most any solid block into its various slots to customize the Framed Storage Drawer. There are slots for Face, Edges, and Sides.

display:10.Name:8: Any Trim
Any Framed Drawer
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Technological Drawers
questDatabase.description:
Large banks of Storage Drawers are excellent when you have items sorted and ready to pull out when you need them, but restocking them can eat up valuable Research and Crafting time. 
    Thus we've come up with the Storage Controller. It will connect to all Storage Drawers within 12 blocks that are connected. Drawers are considered 'connected' if they are touching other drawers that are touching the Storage Controller.
    You can pipe items into the Storage Controller and it will automatically place them into Drawers, either in existing storage spots, or filling empty ones. You can also hold an item and Right Click it on the front of the Storage Controller to deposit it into the network. Sneak + Right Click will attempt to put all items in your inventory into the network, but ONLY if a drawer already contains that item. (This is so you don't dump your entire inventory into a large network.
    The Controller Slave connects like other Storage Drawers in a Network, and enable you to have more sides to pipe items into it.
    The Compacting Drawer is a special drawer. Technically, it only holds item, but in up to three states. For example, if you put a stack of Iron Ingots into one, it will allow you to take out or put in Iron Nuggets or Blocks of Iron as well.

questDatabase.name: Track Check
questDatabase.description:
§o    Want to check all your reputation tracks?  You can use this repeatable quest to check them, or you can type the following command :
    §l/scoreboard players list (your player name)§r§o
    If you play on a server, both this quest and that command may not work for you if you don't have the proper permissions.

questDatabase.name: To the Meteors!
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k.........§r power §k.......§rtus Quartz§k...........§r antastic Meteorite Compass §k.....................§r locate §k.........§r Sky Stone Meteors§k................§r plates §k.....................§r collect all four Inscription Plates§k............§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Bandit, we've deciphered a bit more of the transmission. There are these Meteorites scattered around the world, which apparently contain Inscription Plates we'll need to continue our research.
    Linguist Lenny : Given some of the trasnmission context, we were able to use a Charged Certus Quartz to fashion ourselves what is called a Meteorite Compass. Fascinating!
    Dataologist Dante : Proprieter Penny gave us some Certus Quartz samples she found, as well as some of this black stone that gave off a similar signature. The Meteorite Compass always pointed towards the nearest chunk of it unless it was in a box or bag!
    Linguist Lenny : She also gave us a couple of the Inscription Plates the transmission talks about. They were found inside the black stone, and she says she had a bunch more, as well.
    Dataologist Dante : Too bad she refused to just send you a set. Sorry, Bandit, she runs the shop with an iron power glove. She'll happily sell you the plates though, if you don't want to go Meteor Hunting!
    Linguist Lenny : She also grinned when she said she had a lot of that stone. Sky Stone, we're calling it, since it looks to be part of those meteors.
    Dataologist Dante : Well, either way, collect all four plates, some Sky Stone, and a Sky Stone Chest when you can.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Crystals!
questDatabase.description:
--------
   §k......§r al Certus Quartz §k..................§r artz §k........§r find §k.....§r over §k.....§r world! §k......§r amaz§k............§r confi§k...........§r  product§k.............§r r Certus Quartz! §k................§r lines §k..................§r your order!
    §k..........§r act §k.............§r get §k...........§r Charged Certus Quartz §k..........§r energizes §k.........§r devices we're §k.............§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Interesting, it seems the transmission is bouncing off of these Certus Quartz deposits in your world. That might be why they are being distorted?
    Linguist Larry : Possibly, but the original source may be corrupted as well. I'm finding more references to this Certus Quartz in the transmissions as well.
    Dataologist Dante : I'd say it's time to gather some of this Certus Quartz for more research. Bandit, the QUEST Tablet scanner shows Certus Quartz is scattered underground, slightly uncommon. The Charged Certus Quartz is a bit rarer, but should be around the same depths.
    Linguist Larry : These Certus Quartz Crystals... I'd check with Penny in the TFB Corporate Catalog. She might be selling any extra the Business has collected from other dimensional mining operations.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Fluix Crystals
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k...§r know §k.....§r Charged Certus Quartz §k.....§r put §k.....§r Redstone §k.........§r Nether Quartz into §k....§r Water §k.....§r creating Fluix Crystals§k....§r what §k....§r with them? §k...§r glad §k....§r ask§k...§r
    §k......§r hard §k.....§r Sky Stone §k.......§r patented §k......§r fantastic §k.....§r Stick§k......§ry §k.......§r Pistons §k...§r Fluix Crystal§k...§r make §k....§r Inscriber§k...§r press §k....§r hardest of materials with §k....§r Plates!
--------

    Linguist Lenny : I think I'm starting to get a better handle on this strange language, even with the distortion and corruption. 
    Dataologist Dante : And I'm starting to work out this technology it's talking about. Watch, if we drop a Charged Certus Quartz, a Redstone Dust, and a Nether Quartz a pool of water....
    Linguist Lenny : Hey, that's kind of pretty. What'd the transmission call it... a Fluix Crystal? Looks like it'll be useful.
    Dataologist Dante : I agree. The other part of the transmission mentioned a few things...and I figured out a device that should be close to what it was describing. The Inscriber should be a useful device when we figure out how to power it.
    Linguist Lenny : Wait, it doesn't take RF Energy?
    Dataologist Dante : It does, but it seems to be one of the few test machines I've made that does so far. Let's keep listening to the transmissions, maybe we can figure something out for the other machines...

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Form Before Function
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k...§r you know?§k......§r these Crystals §k......§r useful §k........§r offer§k...§r fantastic decorative §k........§r
    §k.......§r strong §k..§r support §k....§r Stairs §k..§rSlabs §k...§r fantastic as Pillars§k......§r Bricks §k..........§r
--------

    Linguist Larry : Not much new stuff in this transmission, at least when it comes to figuring out these devices and other things.
    Dataologist Dante : Hmm, looks to be talking about turning these materials into building materials. StairS? I guess if they are pretty, some architect can make use of them.
    Linguist Larry : Bandit, I wouldn't ask you to waste too many materials on these, but theres a bunch more things you can make than just these three things.

questDatabase.name: Charged Up
questDatabase.description:
--------
   §k.....§r power tools §k......§r charged§k............§r special Charger! §k........§r charge §k......§r Quartz §k..............§r
--------

    Linguist Larry : What a short transmission.
    Dataologist Dante : True, but it sounds like we can charge Certus Quartz ourselves. But the prototype charger I have here doesn't work.
    Linguist Larry : Try using Fluix Crystals as components. I get the feeling that's the only way it would work.
    Dataologist Dante : Hm, possibly. Still not working... no wait, there we go. I had to set the Charger on top of the energy source. Some sort of proprietary system? Weird for just a bunch of Crystals...
    Linguist Larry : But not really out of place. But hey, it looks like it'll charge RF Energy tools as well as Certus Quartz. That should definitely help you out, Bandit.

questDatabase.name: Growing Supply
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k......§r know §k......§rur Certus Quartz §k........§r so incred§k.....§r can §k....§r grow §k.......§r special §k......§r sand§k.....§r Certus Dust§k.....§r Water§k....§r crystaliza§k.....§r takes §k......§r hours §k.....§ratented for§k......§r not decay §k......§r inexhaustable §k....§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Interesting, this communication seems to suggest that we can grow more Certus Quartz.
    Linguist Larry : Not surprised, you never grew rock candy as a little kit?
    Dataologist Dante : You can do that? Dang, glad I didn't know that, I would probably have fake teeth by now if I did.
    Linguist Larry : Yeah, should be pretty simple. So, it says to combine Certus Dust and Sand... the Quartz Grindstone should get us the Dust easily. Now mix and... yeah, that worked pretty well. One Certus Quartz Seed.
    Dataologist Dante : Then you just put it in some water, yeah? Here, I had maintenance install a small pond in the corner, since it seems we're working with some unique technology.
    Linguist Larry : Not the weirdest thing I've seen in the labs here. Okay, the seed is in the water. Got the scanner going?
    Dataologist Dante : Sure. And looks like it works. Scanner is showing a very slow but steady increase in size. Estimation says a couple hours.
    Linguist Larry : Hm, the data says the structure is more Pure. Should be usable in most of the same applications. Hey, Bandit, I bet you can do the same with Fluix Crystals. And maybe even Nether Quartz. That should help you out with limited materials.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The ME Network
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k.......§r shown §k..........§r tip §k......§r iceberg§k.......§r comes together §k..........§r thing §k.......§r call §k.....§r Mat§k..§r E§k....§r Network!
    §k.......§r ME Network §k.......§r simple§k...........§r Quartz Fiber §k....§r hook §k........§r devices together§k...........§r supply power §k.......§r connected devices §k.......§r Energy Acceptor§k.....§r converts RF §k.....§r into AE §k.....§r efficient§k.....§r
    §k.....§r store extra AE §k.......§r Energy Cell §k.........§r 
--------

    Dataologist Dante : I've requested some schematics from the other tech branches of The Ferret Business. These transmissions aren't getting any easier to translate unfortunately.
    Linguist Larry : Dishearteningly so. What I can figure from this one is that you can use Fluix crystals and Certus Quartz to create... a network?
    Dataologist Dante : M. E. Network. Massive Energy? No... Matter Energy?
    Linguist Larry : What? But Matter and Energy are two different things...
    Dataologist Dante : There's theories about that. But, deciphering this transmission, it sounds like theres a few devices that can be used in an ME Network, and it has its own power type. AE Energy. Let me put some of this together...
    Linguist Larry : Another power type? What's that make, five now? We really need to make a solid standard....
    Dataologist Dante : And then we would have six types. At least they are easy to convert between... except this AE. Looks like I can put RF Energy into the ME Network, but I can't pull it out. The Quartz Fiber transfers energy over the entire network, but only power our Applied Energistics devices it looks like.
    Linguist Larry : That's slightly annoying. So, RF Energy goes into the Energy Acceptor here, which turns it into AE Energy, which can be stored in the Energy Cell?
    Dataologist Dante : Correct.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Better Inscribing
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k..§r wait! §k........§r Inscriber too simple §k...............§r get §k.......§rAdvanced Inscriber!
    §k...§r hooking §k....§r ME Network, §k.......§r import and export §k..§r any side §k.......§r multiple Speed upgrades §k....§r work faster!
--------

    Dataologist Dante : A short transmission. Looks like we can upgrade the Inscriber?
    Linguist Larry : Sounds like it. What was wrong with the normal one?
    Dataologist Dante : Well, I tried hooking it up to some of our standard automation conduits and stuff. It was very picky about which side had which input or output. This Advanced Inscriber sounds like it solves that issue.
    Linguist Larry : What are Speed upgrades?
    Dataologist Dante : Not sure. None of the transmissions we've deciphered mention them... do they?

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Acceleration
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k....§r know §k......§r going to say§k..........§r Crystal Seeds §k.....§r hours to grow§k...........§r free§k....§r not be §k.........§r slow §k............§r
    §k......§r power §k...........§r ME Network§k....§r speed §k..........§r growth rate§k......§r upgrade §k....§r Quartz Fiber§k......§r Glass Cables §k..........§r Fluix Crystals§k.....§r incredible §k....§r Crystal Growth Accelerator!
    Hook §k.....§r top or bottom§k....§r water it touches §k....§r supercharged, speeding §k......§r Crystal Seeds §k.........§r
    Not fast §k......§r multiple §k.........§r Act §k...§r we'll §k.....§r three for §k.....§r two! §k....§r throw §k....§r extra §k...........§r Crystal Seeds for you!
--------

    Dataologist Dante : The more we understand on these transmissions, the more confused I get.
    Linguist Larry : Hopefully we can get an uncorrupted transmission at some point. 
    Dataologist Dante : Well, for now, we have another one to decipher. Hmm, it looks like this one is talking about those Crystal Seeds.
    Linguist Larry : The ones that take hours to grow.
    Dataologist Dante : Yep, but it looks like we can speed it up. Hmm... yeah, looks like we can use the Fluix Crystals to upgrade Quartz Fiber into ME Glass Cables.
    Linguist Larry : To what benefit?
    Dataologist Dante : Not sure yet. But looks like I can dye the cables. I don't like them being... bare like that though.
    Linguist Larry : Why not wrap them in some Wool?
    Dataologist Dante : ME Covered Cable? Why not. That'd be a great way to run two different cable lines next to each other without connecting them, as well.
    Linguist Larry : Good. What about this Crystal Growth Accelerator? Sounds like something especially helpful for Bandit here. Time is money, and time is survival as well.
    Dataologist Dante : Let me try a few things with this new cable... oh, turning the Fluix Crystals into a Fluix Block gives us a solid base... some Iron... ah, there we go!
    Linguist Larry : Wow, the scans say those Crystal Seeds ARE growing a good deal faster!
    Dataologist Dante : And the transmission sounds like the effect stacks. Bandit, do note that the ME Cable has to connect to the top or bottom of these. The water that's charged is directly adjacent to the Accelerator too. I bet you can come up with a pretty compact design to really speed up the growth.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: The ME Controller
questDatabase.description: §1Josh§r: I think i found a way to make a controller to control all of the various applications of the ME system! I will pass you over the schematics and try and see if it works!

questDatabase.name: Ore Doubling
questDatabase.description:
--------
    §k...........§r useful §k............§r crafty §k..........§r running out §k........§rrite metals §k..........§r going §k..........§r gold mines §k............§r grind §k............§r invention§k...................§r Quartz§k..........§r Grindstone! §k............§r no electricity §k...........§r simple §k.........§r Wooden Crank §k........§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Well that's interesting.
    Linguist Lenny : What?
    Dataologist Dante : One of the Deep miners popped in, hearing that we finally found a use for this Certus Quartz. 
    Linguist Lenny : The ones who wear heavy armor and weapons to go mining?
    Dataologist Dante : Yep! He looked at our research, grabbed a handful of Certus Quartz, stuffed it into a wood and stone box with a Gear, slapped a a Wooden Crank onto it, and...
    Linguist Lenny : They're always very strange. What the hell was he making?
    Dataologist Dante : Let me finish, okay? He stuffed an Iron Ore into it and started turning the crank, like a Jack n the Box. Just kept Right Clicking the crank. Suddenly, a bunch of Iron Dust popped out. He popped out a pocket Smelter...
    Linguist Lenny : They just keep those in their pocket? Weird.
    Dataologist Dante : Right? Well, he smelted it on the spot, and got two normal sized Iron Ingots out of one Iron Ore!
    Linguist Lenny : Now that's useful.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Applied Energistics
questDatabase.description:
--------
    Hello §k....§re §k ...§r Josh§k ..........§r and new§k .......§r invention f§k ........§r storage §k ......§r Crystal §k ...............§r items §k ....§r pure§k .........§r data §k .....................§r crystals §k ...........§r grow §k ............................§r space §k ............§r room §k ......§r boxes!
--------

    Linguist Larry : Welcome to the Applied Energistics lab, Bandit. As you can see, this is about the average amount I'm able to translate from these strange transmissions we've been getting.
    Dataologist Dante : They started as soon as you arrived in that location and repeat every night around 1 AM.
    Linguist Larry : They don't seem to be a distress beacon, but it's a little hard to tell as the transmissions seem to be... corrupted and distorted. 
    Dataologist Danta : Well, there should be enough to work with at least... it's talking about Crystals as data storage, right? Well... Bandit, could you grab some Nether Quartz and a Diamond while we try to translate more?

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Better Growth
questDatabase.description:
--------
   §k.......§r probably asking "But §k...§rstill §k.......§r drop §k.....§r Seeds §k......§r water§k...§r risky§k.......§r accidently pick §k...§r up!"
    §k......§r newest prod§k...§r help§k...........§r Crystal Growth Chamber §k........§r enclosed §k.......§r Crystal Seed growing §k.....§r can §k....§r mix Fluix Crystals §k..........§r input §k.....§r ingredients!
    §k.......§rzing new machine §k....§raccept §k......§rSpeed upgrades!
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Another short one. Not much new for the lexicon I take it?
    Linguist Larry : A little new, a little changed, a little marked 'probably wrong' unfortunately. But thats how translating unknown languages goes some times.
    Dataologist Dante : Test, retest, retest, confirm. I hear ya. Let's see... this sounds like theres an upgraded version of the Crystal Growth Accelerator? A Chamber instead.
    Linguist Larry : Right, safer than just leaving the seeds sitting in the water. Easier to control.
    Dataologist Dante : Right! Looks like we can pipe in the ingredients to make Fluix Crystals too. That's helpful. But another mention of Speed Upgrades. I should probably figure those out.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Channels
questDatabase.description: §1Josh:§r The ME Controller from my tests allows up to 32 channels.. I have yet to fully understan where and HOW it get's it's 32 channels... the cables you are probably using does not allow up to 32 yet, only up to 8 and thats where this Dense cables come into use..

questDatabase.name: P2P
questDatabase.description:
§1Josh:§r
P2P's are a bit special. they allow a couple of items to pass through from 1 tunnel to the other tunnel. they also help to cut down on the amount of channels required for.. Example 32 Disk Drives.

P2P 101:
to connect 2 p2p's together, make sure it is the following
- Same type of p2p tunnel (ME <-/-> RF)
- Both are powered and on the same network
Step 1:
get yourself a §lMemory Card§r
Step 2:
SHIFT-Right click on 1 of the P2P (it should say settings stored)
Step 3:
right click on the other p2p and should say ('successfuly loaded settings')
if all goes well it should be linked! Try it!
Oh! To clear it, shift right click with the memory card in the air or any block that does not accept p2p.

questDatabase.description: §1Josh§r: Yes! Cards! I know that does't sound exciting but they are able to unlock more capabilities or make a particular bus/block more inteligent The basics is that you will need Try crafting a couple of §5Basic and Advanced Cards§r and send them over so that i can have a look.

questDatabase.name: Ad-Hoc Networks
questDatabase.description: §1Josh:§r It seems that all these blocks seems to be able to be connected even though the Controller is no present.They all need power via a §lPower acceptor§r. However they can go only up to 8 busses/Blocks that uses AE Channels before the entire system fails.

questDatabase.name: Circuit and Processor
questDatabase.description:
--------
   §k......§r deeper §k............§r power §k.....§r Inscriber, Plates§k...§r ingredients§k..........§r imprint §k......§r circuitry patterns §k.........§r digitally conductive §k........§r Pure Certus Quartz, Diamonds, and Gold§k.....§r
    §k....§r press together §k.........§r Printed Silicon, Circuit§k....§r Redstone§k.........§r make §k....§r Processors§k.....§r
--------

    Linguist Larry : Every time I think we've got a handle on the language in these transmissions, it gets stranger.
    Dataologist Dante : I wonder if the corruption in the transmissions is a big part of that.
    Linguist Larry : It could also be local slang. Or even worse, abbreviations.
    Dataologist Dante : I D K, don't you like talking about your B F...
    Linguist Larry : No no no. Sorry about that Bandit, the QUEST Tablet doesn't quite transcribe the sounds of my brain shutting off.
    Dataologist Dante : Right, sorry, not su... wait, what's that phrase there? "digitally conductive"? I get the feeling its not talking about internet stuff like data transfer rate. 
    Linguist Larry : Me either. It sounds like we can use the Inscriber and those Plates to make Circuits, which we can then make Processors out of.
    Dataologist Dante : Huh, well I guess 3D printing is already making its way to homes, why not powerful processor presses?

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

questDatabase.name: Dust to Silicone
questDatabase.description:
--------
   §k.....§r Quartz Grindstone §k...........§r break down §k.........§r you to break §k.....§r patented Certus Quartz§k.....§r other fantastic §k............§r Fluix Crystals, Nether Qua§k...............§r
    §k.....§r can use §k...........§r Inscriber §k..§rlicon Press Plate, §k..........§r turn Silicon §k.....§r Printed Circuit!
    §k.....§r Quartz Dust be used for? §k.........§r mixing §k.....§r Glass §k.......§r better Quartz Glass§k............§r get it to Glow§k............§r quite Vibrant!
--------

    Linguist Larry : Hrm. This transmission was easier to decode. Lots of repeated words. That helps the lexicon at least.
    Dataologist Dante : Great! This one is easier to figure out at least. Looks like grinding Certus Quartz and other things will get us Dust. And we can use that dust to make things like Quartz Glass.
    Linguist Larry : Vibrant... hey, try adding some Glowstone Dust to the Quartz Glass too. 
    Dataologist Dante : More dust eh? Not a bad idea.
    Linguist Larry : Well, Bandit, might as well grind down some Nether Quartz and Sky Stone as well. Maybe you can find a use for it soon. In the meantime, what about the Inscriber it's talking about, Dante?
    Dataologist Dante : That's the only part of the transmission that's not clear. You don't grind Sand into Silicone, you Smelt it.
    Linguist Larry : Translation error? Well, the next part is clearer then. Looks like we can turn the Silicone into a Printed Circuit with the Inscriber.

questLines.name: Initial Research
questLines.description: §lAssistant Bandit§r, we need to scan the planet, asteroid, dimension, and/or reality that you arrived at. Provide samples to §3§lBiologist Bitsy§r and in return she'll get you in contact with more staff here, as well as open the §3§lCorporate Shop§r for you.

questLines.name: [FRD] Ferret Resources Dept
questLines.description: Greetings, §d§lBandit§r. I am §3§lRecruiter Rodney§r from the §3§lFR Department§r. That's §3§lFerret Resources Department§r. I handle §lhiring§r and §lfiring§r new employees, and more importantly to you, I oversee many aspects of employee life, including §lbenefits§r and more within §3§lThe Ferret Business.§r  I will also handle exchanging §3§lSilver Coins§r into §3§lShop Vouchers§r for §3§lProprieter Penny§r.

questLines.name: [FRD] Large Scale Orders
questLines.description:
§3§lRecruiter Rodney§r here. Raw materials are not the only thing we sell in the Ferret Business, we also sell a wide variety of merchandise. You've probably seen the Supply and Demand system in place from §3§lProprieter Penny§r, which is good for supplying us with a small variety of items.
    I, instead, handle the large volume purchases. The ones that handle thousands upon thousands of a single item. These are distributed among our many chains of stores, and I coordinate the logistics of this.
    If you are in need of even more coins than just providing small crates of goods, then please look at what I am in need of currently.

questLines.name: [FRD] Researchology
questLines.description:
INITIALIZING INTERFACE
...
SCANNING IDENTIFICATION
...
GREETINGS §d§lBANDIT§r
   I AM §3§lM-A8301-X819§r, OR §3§lM.A.X.§r FOR SHORT. I AM PART OF A NEW SYSTEM FOR THE FERRET RESOURCES DEPARTMENT.
   I CATALOGUE AND DISTRIBUTE §5§lRESEARCH MATERIALS§r TO MANY LABORATORIES WITHIN §3§lTHE FERRET BUSINESS§r. I AM NOW AUTHORIZED BY THE §3§lCEO§r TO GIVE YOU §2§lPAYMENT§r, KNOWN AS A §2§lBOUNTY§r, FOR PROVIDING VARIOUS §5§lRESEARCH MATERIALS§r.

questLines.name: Exploring Your World
questLines.description:
Hey there §d§lBandit§r, my name is §3§lExplorer Eric§r. I'm an §lexplorer§r, an §ladventurer§r, sort of like you've just become! 
    Oh. Uh. Sorry about that... but thats why I've been asked to help you out! As a seasoned adventurer, there are a lot of little tricks and tips I can give you to help you §lsurvive§r in that new world you've discovered! 
    Thankfully it seems that in your §lworld§r, you can't §ldie§r of anything but old age, so we don't have to worry about that and take SOME risks... cause you know, dieing ain't final, but pain still hurts!

questLines.name: Building Your Home
questLines.description:
Hello hello there! My name is §5§lDaisy§r, and I'm a §lDecorator§r, §lDesigner§r, §lDeveloper§r... some other things that aren't as important, but my §lmain passion§r is §lDesigning§r and §lDecorating§r! I'm known as §3§lDecorator Daisy§r, and I can help you §lspruce§r up your §lHome§r slash §lBase§r slash §lCave§r, and make it feel more §lcomfortable§r! 
    Step on in...

questLines.name: Protecting Your Assets
questLines.description: Hi there Bandit! My name is Serge, I'm an assisting to Engineer Erin and leading Stockmaster for many of the labs and shops around the Ferret Business. I was asked to help you get a little more organized in your...well, wherever you happened to land. Hopefully we'll be able to get you home soon, but my understanding it might be a while, and its a dangerous world. Sometimes, knowing where your sword, your food, and your towel are stored at any time can be the key to survival.

questLines.name: Magical Flowers
questLines.description:
Hi there Bandit. I'm Occult Botonist Belle, lead researcher of uh... lets just say unique plants. Apparently when you crossbreed and genetically modify plants to make synthetic meat and bodyparts, or make them start walking around demanding to be fed blood, you're suddenly.... nevermind! 
    Not important! What IS important is you've found some very very interesting plants! Working together, I bet we can make a LOT of interesting discoveries!

questLines.name: Bit o This n That
questLines.description:
Hey there Bandit! Good to meet you! 
    Biologist Bitsy passed those materials I kind of maybe hinted at wanting to look at to me, and I'm quite pleased with them! I think she just wanted me to stop bugging her, but thats fine, I got what I was after! I'm Inventologist Irvine, lets see what we can invent!

questLines.name: Conduit Machinery
questLines.description:
Hello, Bandit. The samples you sent me are quite nice, and I think they'll be quite servicable for what I'd like to show you. You've got a whole lot of materials, items, machines, and other such collection of items you need to deal with. I can definitely teach you a whole slew of things about Input and Output of an inventory system. 
    And who knows, some of the research here on your world may even help me broaden my own knowledge and abilities, and I'll share those profits with you. Oh, my name? I'm Engineer Erin. A pleasure to meet you.

questLines.name: Machine Life
questLines.description:
Hello, hello? Bandit? I... oh! It connected! Good, didn't feel like breaking my tools out already. My name is Mechanic Meeko, and I'm one of the head factory engineers in The Ferret Business. The other one is my twin sister, have you met her yet? 
    No? Well... trust, me, she's my twin. Where were we? Ah yes, let's talk more in private, okay?

questLines.name: Automation Station
questLines.description:
[Clank]
    [Clank]
    [Clank]
    Dang th... oh, it's working finally! Greetings, Bandit! I'm Machinist Meeka! My twin brother and I are the head factory engineers here! We make sure things are automated like... well... clockwork! A well oiled machine! A well choreographed mechanical dance! 
    Come on, lets go talk more in private!

questLines.name: Crystals and Essences
questLines.description:
Tell me, kit, do you believe in magic? Well, of course you do, thats a foolish question. 
    Do you believe in the existance of auras, the power of crystals, and the infinite depth of magic itself? Now that... that is a proper question! 
    My name is Wizard Watson. Please, step into my study, Bandit, I feel we can definitely help each other to answer this...

questLines.name: Soul Food
questLines.description:
Welcome, welcome to the §3§lCafe la Ferret§r! Here, we create all sorts of delicacies, from the familiar to the strange!
    We are a trio of researchers who are working on new foods, from planting to plate! We'd like to thank you for introducing us to even more §lfoods§r to expand our palettes with, Bandit.  
    Who are we, you ask? We would be: §3§lMaster Gardener Grey§r, §3§lHead Chef Charlie§r, and §3§lFood Critic Candy§r, at your service!

questLines.name: Crystaline Storage
questLines.description:
G'day, Bandit! My name is Dataologist Dante and with me is Linguist Larry. I handle researching new, more efficient data storage and handling methods, while Larry handles translating unknown languages.
    Your strange location has presented us with new alien technology to research, and Larry and I have created a new research branch to explore the ability to store items as pure data and energy.
    We call this new branch Applied Energistics. Would you like to help us?

questLines.name: Special Research
questLines.description: Greetings, §d§lBandit§r, my name is §3§lCaigan§r. You've done a lot for §3§lThe Ferret Business§r so far, a real asset! We have much to discuss though...
